text: EXT. LANDING AREA OUTSIDE 4077TH MASH – DAY Our attention is concentrated on a sign reading: "THIS IS WHERE IT IS – PARALLEL 38." Below these words, arrows poi to "NORTH KOREA" in one direction, "SOUTH KOREA" in oppos one. Two Air Rescue helicopters are coming in low from th north, descending to a point just outside the entrance to the hospital Admitting Ward. Transferring our attention to the helicopters, our gaze g from the first sign to a second one, on which all we can  read at first are the very large letters: "M-A-S-H." Movi closer to the helicopters as they hit the ground, we can  make out the rest of the sign. Above the four large lette it says: "4077TH," and then we see there is the remainder a word following each of the large letters, but in much  smaller print, so that "M-A-S-H" becomes "Mobile Army Sur Hospital." The helicopters land and enlisted men of the U Army Medical Corps Carry two wounded soldiers from each i the Admitting Ward. LIEUTENANT COLONEL HENRY BLAKE, a permanent member of the Medical Corps and Commanding Officer of the 4077th, watch grimly as the wounded are borne from the helicopters into his hospital. CORPORAL "RADAR" O'REILLY, with a long thin neck, large ears and a knack for anticipating his Colonel wishes, moves up close behind him.
(loudly) O'Reilly!
(at his side) Yes, sir?
Dammit, Radar, wait till I call you!  Tell Major Burns...
One of the surgeons from the day  shift will have to stay on duty  tonight?
Yes, dammit, and...

He interrupts himself, frightened by the intense expressi on Radar's face. The Corporal's head is turning back and  forth like an actual radar receiver, monitoring the north horizon where the valley of a river meanders between  mountainous ridges.
O'Reilly, what is it? (appalled at the  thought) There aren't more choppers coming?
I'm afraid so, Colonel.
We've got too many wounded for us to  handle now! Get on the phone right  away and...
Yes, sir, I'll see if I can reach  General Hammond in Seoul for you.  You think he'll finally break down  and give us two more surgeons?
The DISTANT SOUND of more HELICOPTERS becomes faintly aud to the normal human ear, and a moment later one appears o a ridge.

EXT. MOTOR POOL AND RAILROAD DEPOT – 325TH EVACUATION  HOSPITAL – YONG-DONG-PA – DAY Two officers come from opposite directions toward a Jeep, each carrying a Valpac and trailing a barracks bag. Thoug they still wear such later-to-be-discarded refinements as captain's bars on their caps and overcoats, they are far  from West Point standards in dress and manner. DUKE, 29, still solidly built like the fullback he once was. HAWKEY 28, a former end, is taller and rangier, wears glasses. T accents, Georgia and Maine respectively, are in sharp  contrast. A MOTOR POOL SARGEANT who has driven the Jeep u climbs out.
You the guys going to the 4077th?
I'm one of 'em.
(state of Maine  affirmative) Ayuh. I'm the other then.
As they stow their gear in the back of the Jeep.
Lots of luck.
He leaves.
My name's Hawkeye Pierce.
Duke Forrest.
Hawkeye takes the driver's seat. Duke, getting into the r hand side, has no objection, just a question.
You got directions?
Ayuh, only it's early, I need a drink  to wake me up.
I got some.
He turns around and opens his barracks bag, where he find pint bottle conveniently located near the top.
Make it yourself, or is it real?
Georgia, where I come from, it's  real if you make it yourself. But I  been buying from the Yankee Government  since they put me in this soldier  suit and give me a rate.
Tax-free booze. It's about all you  can say for army life.
(passing bottle) Where you from with that crazy way  of talking?
Crabapple Cove. Maine.
Damn! That must be about as far north  as you can get.
Pretty near. What do you know about  the outfit we're going to?
C.O. is Colonel Blake. Lieutenant  Colonel Henry Braymore Blake. One of  them regular army clowns. Push you  around so it's hard to get any decent  work done.
We got to head them off, right at  the start. Push them around first.
They have exchanged the bottle a couple of times. In the of raising it to his mouth, Hawkeye looks toward the hosp doorway.
I think we already caught their eye.
Two MPs have emerged from the hospital administration off and are heading toward them. Hawkeye goes into action qui starting the Jeep engine.
What's the initials 'MP' stand for,  Hawkeye?
Shore Patrol, Duke. Let's go!
The Jeep starts off at its maximum takeoff speed and  accelerates dangerously as it careens out of the hospital grounds.

EXT. ROAD NEAR OUIJONGBU – DAY Hawkeye and Duke are driving the Jeep along the muddy roa they come upon a sign which fills a large part of the scr "Last chance before Peking". A short distance behind the  sign, it is now revealed are three parked U.S. Army truck in front of which parades a group of Korean prostitutes f fourteen to forty-five. Despite the autumn weather, their costumes, mixed America mail order and Korean, are chosen for seductive appeal ra than warmth.
Must be the Famous Curb Service Whore  – (pronounced 'howah') House. You in the market Duke?
(in negation) I done my shopping in Seoul last  night.
They now have a fairly clear view of a GI and a Korean fe lying in tight formation in the bed on one of the trucks, their activity only partially concealed by a blanket.
Curb service is right.

EXT. APPROACH TO 4077TH MASH – DAY Hawkeye stops the Jeep as they come to a place in the roa where they can get a downward look at their future home. river valley in which the 4077th Mash is situated is almo surrounded by mountains. The components of the post are s out in a rough horseshoe with a large compound of level g in the middle. At the closed end of the horseshoe is the  main hospital building, made of wood with a tin roof mark by a large red cross; everything else is canvas. To the l of the main building are strung out the Admitting Ward,  Laboratory, Dental Clinic, Mess Hall, PX, Showers Tent, B Tent and the Enlisted Men's Tents. On the right side are Postop Ward, Officers' Tents, Nurses' Tents, Korean Domes Tents and finally, the Officers' Club. In the f.g., from  Duke and Hawkeye's angle are four helicopters belonging t the 5th Air Rescue Squadron, and the signs we have alread seen marking the post and the 38th Parallel.
Well, there it is. Jesus!
The spot we picked to spend the  winter. Maybe we ought to look a  little harder.

INT. MASH MESS HALL – DAY As Hawkeye and Duke enter. The large tent has two floor l separated by a railing into a section for officers and on for enlisted men, the two groups being much closer to  numerical equality here than in an ordinary military  installation. There is a further voluntary piece of  segregation within the officers' section: the men – medic officers plus a couple of administrative officers and a  helicopter pilot – are at one long, rectangular table; th nurses, ranging in rank from second lieutenant to captain at another. Hawkeye starts to lead the way to an empty table in the  officers' section, but Duke calls his attention to the  outstanding feature of the nurses' table: LIEUTENANT DISH 24, blonde and clearly, even in her winter fatigues, the  sexiest looking nurse in military history.
What do you think of that piece of  scenery, Yankee boy?
Finest kind. We'll sit where we can  get the best view.

Accordingly, they select seats close to the nurses and fa the Lieutenant. Some personnel are on duty in the hospita during this lunch period, but beside Dish, two of the  following three nurses with whom we will become acquainte are present here: KNOCKO, who is black, a captain in her thirties, solidly  built, very strong and very competent in her job; LESLIE, also a captain, not more than thirty, bright, attractive, cheerful, the kind of girl that brings out the latent mal matrimonial instinct but who, strangely, is treated as  inviolate by the by the sex-starved men of the post; and  LIEUTENANT SCORCH, who can't match Dish or Leslie by phys standards but has the asset of instant availability. A Korean boy, not yet of military age, in green fatigue p and an off-white coat, appears promptly and heaps Duke an Hawkeye's plates with food. Duke is hungry enough to turn his whole attention to the meal, but Hawkeye is unable to keep his eyes off Lieutenant Dish while eating. Thus neit of them is aware of the attention they are getting from t male officers' group, which includes HENRY, a couple of  medical captains named MURRHARDT and BANDINI; DAGO RED  (officially, Father John Patrick Mulcahy, red-haired Cath Chaplain of the area) and the PAINLESS POLE (Captain Walt Zaldowski, Dental Officer), both in their thirties; and  CAPTAIN UGLY JOHN BLACK, an Australian anesthesiologist. There is also curiosity about the newcomers from the unli men's section, where we see among others RADAR; VOLLMER,  Henry's overweight Sargeant Major; CORPORAL JUDSON, young black and fresh from Mississippi; PRIVATE BOONE, who look too young and nervous to be in any man's army; and PFC  SEIDMAN, whose first trip out of New York has taken him  halfway around the world. Henry, who alone has reason to be personally affronted by Duke and Hawkeye's unmilitary behavior, gets up and cross to where they are sitting.
I'm Colonel Blake. You fellows just  passing through?
Nope, we're assigned heah.
With which reminder we will abandon all indications of th Maine accent.
Y'all were short a couple cutters  and we're what the Army sent.
Don't you know the first thing you're  supposed to do at a new post is  present yourself to the commanding  officer with your orders?
Reckon so, but we been boozing all  day and you work up an appetite.
(taking out orders  and handing Duke a  copy) You're welcome to one of these,  whatever they are.
(finding his orders) They give you copies to burn.
Henry scans both papers to find what he considers the mos important part. There is a RUMBLE OF ARTILLERY in the  distance.
Good. You've both been working close  to the front.
(listening to artillery) Never this close.
They've hit us on Cherry Hill. I  just got word. We have our slack  periods but when the action starts,  you'll have more work in twelve hours  than a civilian surgeon does in a  week.
Colonel Blake, have no fear. Hawkeye  and Duke are here.
(to Henry) That's right, pal. You just sit up  front and sign the mail, and leave  the cutting to us.
I may need you to go to work  practically immediately. But meanwhile  perhaps you'd like to meet some of  your fellow officers.
Just one for a start.
The blonde dish.
If you mean... (looking toward  Lieutenant Dish) She is a lieutenant in the Army  Nursing Corps, Captain.
Okay, Lieutenant Dish. I guess she's  already... involved with somebody  here.
They've all tried. Nobody's got to  first base.

He is interrupted by the fact that Dish and Knocko have r from their table and are passing right by them on their w to the door. The Lieutenant has just as nice a walk as you would hope  for, and the men's eyes follow her till she is again out hearing distance.
Why bother with first base? I'd go  right for the home run.
The Painless Pole and Dago Red have come over.
This the new talent, Henry?
Captain Pierce, Captain Forrest...  Father Mulcahy, the Catholic Chaplain  of the area, and Captain Waldowski,  our Dental Officer.
Better known as Painless Pole.
Murrhardt and Bandini come over and all ADLIB introductio – asking each other their backgrounds, etc.
We all call him Dago Red.
I'm Duke and he's Hawkeye.
Glad to know you. Drop in at my clinic  anytime you feel like playing a little  poker, or even if a tooth is bothering  you.
Poker sounds great. When do you play?
He said anytime. Day and night, seven  days a week. The players change but  the game never stops.
(to Hawkeye and Duke) You'll be living with Major Burns.  O'Reilly!
Before his name is uttered, Radar has already risen from enlisted men's group, and is now at Henry's side.
Sir?
Don't do that, Radar! You make me  nervous.
Sir?
Don't come so quickly when I call. I  want you to take these officers...
To Major Burns' tent. Yes, sir.
Stop that, O'Rielly!
Sir?
Oh, get out of here!
Yes, Colonel.

EXT. / INT. "THE SWAMP" (PRESENTLY FRANK'S TENT) – DAY Hawkeye and Duke drag their bags from the Jeep, which Rad drives away. They look over their new residence, a standa army tent, square with peaked roof, a wooden door attache to the canvas. Then as they approach it, they become awar of a youthful Korean voice reading, in heavily accented  English, words that have no meaning for the speaker.
'Yea, though I walk through the valley  of the shadow of death... '
Jesus Christ!
One of his ancestors, I think.
'I shall fear no evil for Thou art  with me...'

They open the door of the tent and go in. There are three canvas cots with sleeping bags on them, a plank floor, an oil stove, electric light, a few crude shelves, one table and one chair plus assorted crates serving as same. MAJOR FRANK BURNS, 35, from Wisconsin, is sitting on one the two more favorably situated cots listening to HO-JON, Korean boy of 16, read from the Bible. He corrects the wo that has given Ho-Jon the most trouble.
Thou. For Thou art with me. (sees Duke and Hawkeye,  jumps up) Welcome, welcome, welcome!
What the hell's going on here?
This is Ho-Jon, my houseboy. Our  houseboy. I'm teaching him English.
Where's he gonna use that kind of  talk? 'The valley of the shadow of  death.' Wait a minute, Ho-Jon... (rummages in barracks  bag) I got something for you.
He takes out sex magazine, gives it to Ho-Jon in such a w that we see the nude on the cover, but Frank doesn't.
(to Frank) Little light reading matter. Just  right for his age.
(to Duke) Well, southern boy, I suppose you  want the sack that's convenient to  the door.
And gets the wind every time it opens.  No, thanks. I'll take that one.
He indicates the unoccupied cot which, like Frank's, is a the rear of the tent with the stove between it and the fr door. Hawkeye shrugs and reaches into his barracks bag.
Let's choose for it. (finds baseball bat,  hands it to Duke) You toss.

Duke tosses the bat vertically in the air. As it comes do Hawkeye grabs it expertly at the tape with his left hand. Duke puts his left hand above that, and Duke is left with his right hand waving in the air with nothing to grab.
(to Ho-Jon) Part of your education. Always use  your own bat.
He tosses Valpac onto the desired cot.

INT. ADMITTING WARD – NIGHT It's pretty full already and more wounded are being broug in by corpsmen. In contrast to the opening scene, where t casualties were a generalized fact seen at a distance, in this scene they are viewed individually and at close rang and the effect, both on the eye and the ear, is almost  unbearable. Hawkeye, in a white gown as are all the surge and nurses, moves from a patient he has just examined to who is letting out a number of unintelligible SOUNDS mixe in with such clear and frequently repeated words as "Chri "Mother," "God damn" and "Please." As Hawkeye approaches, Lieutenant Scorch removes enough of the bandaging done in the field to display an abdomen with part of its contents the outside.
Two-man job. How much blood has he  had?
Second pint.
Duke...
Duke has just examined a patient. He takes a step towards Hawkeye.
This kid's ready but we won't know  all the damage till we get in and  see what's happened. What have you  got?
Nothing can't wait. Shall we check  it out with the Major?
He indicates a Major who is standing a short distance awa looking like a boss but not actually doing anything. Also Admitting Ward are, Murrhardt, Lieutenant Dish, PFC Seidm Corporal Judson.
Naw, I already found out. The only  thing he doesn't like about being in  charge is making decisions.

INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT NOTE: All principal cast should be available for all oper scenes. There are three operations going on at once. Here all  personnel wear white caps and masks and it is hard to ide individuals except that at close range we can distinguish Hawkeye by his glasses and Duke by his eyes and his build They are working together with great efficiency and an  instinctive collaboration that seems to require no verbal exchange. What we see them do, without necessarily recogn the portion of anatomy involved, is to cut out a section bowel damaged by a shell fragment, and start sewing the  divided ends together.

INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye and Duke are working together on the last stages a leg amputation. This time there is no doubt about the  surgical process we are watching; we see the almost sever leg and the process of controlling bleeding; then the lim is actually separated from its stump and handed by Duke t corpsman. Hawkeye speaks to the nurse standing behind him
Hot pack.
Watching her dip the pack into a warm solution and wring out, he recognizes, despite cap and mask, that it is  Lieutenant Dish. His eyes linger on hers for a brief mome

EXT. OUTSIDE OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Lieutenant Dish comes out of the Operating Room, tears in her eyes, trying to control her sobs, and moves just outs the circle of light from the fixture over the entrance. T no longer under observation, she lets herself cry. Hawkey comes out the door, registers surprise at the sight of he just as if he hadn't followed her out. He moves to her si and puts a comforting arm around her. She looks up just long enough to see who it is, then buri her head on his shoulder as his other arm goes around her
Isn't this ridiculous, Doctor? Six  months I've been here and there are  still times when I can't stand it. I  just go to pieces.
There's nothing ridiculous about it. (turns her face up to  his) A kid like you...
She doesn't move her head from the way he has arranged it and her lips are very close to his. He kisses her and it  turns out, from the ardent way she responds, that's what wanted him to do.
Thank you, Captain Pierce. (her voice full of  need) It's been so long.
No trouble at all. (then) Hawkeye.
How did you get called that?
'The Last of the Mohicans.' Only  book my father ever read.
He kisses her again and again she clings to him.
You're getting a workout, you and  Captain Forrest, your first night.
It isn't always this rough?
Oh, no. We have dull stretches every  week or so, thank God, when there's  nothing to do after midnight.
They don't have to be dull. I mean  if you and me put our minds  together...
Our minds?
For a start. I just have a hunch...  well, it isn't entirely a hunch...
You're an attractive man.
You have a certain modest charm  yourself.
(continuing her own  thoughts) But I'm married.
Something else we have in common.
Very happily married.
Same here.
And absolutely determined to be  faithful to my husband. Do we have  that in common, Captain?
It's a matter of definition. Faithful  in spirit, yes.
I don't make the distinction. But  the sex urge is a powerful force. In  women just as much as men.
Ayuh.
You'd think now, with only six weeks  before they ship me back home, it  would be easier. But it isn't.
Of course not.
It's terribly hard. Sometimes the  temptation is just too much.
Then why not, as long as it wouldn't  hurt anybody...?

(not hearing him,  just continuing her  own thought) But you've made me feel strong again,  Captain. Hawkeye. (smiling, tears gone,  ready to return to  work) You helped me pull together when I  needed it.

With a grateful look at him, she goes back inside. Hawkey contemplates the accomplishment she has credited him with and finds it appalling. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye and Duke are working across the table from each o again, this time inside a man's chest, stopping a hemorrh and debriding the wound.
Now that's what I call real pretty.  We can close up here and go into his  belly.
He can't take much more time on the  table.
So we got to cut him fast. I figure  from the X-ray it ain't just the  spleen. We also got to snatch his  right kidney.

EXT. MASH COMPOUND – MORNING Wearing fatigues now, Hawkeye and Duke are making their w way from the hospital to their tent after a night's work. There is an announcement coming over the post-wide public address system, but it doesn't concern them.
(over P.A.) Captain Murrhardt, please report to  the Colonel's office at the earliest  opportunity. Captain Murrhardt.

INT. THE SWAMP – MORNING Ho-Jon throws a match into the oil stove, but it doesn't  work. He looks into it, strikes another match, and this t it lights up so quickly he is almost singed by the flame. Hawkeye and Duke open the door and come in. Ho-Jon straig and bows.
Good morning, Captain Pierce and  Captain Forrest.
You can cut the bow.
I have not understood what you means.
(demonstrating bow) That. It's out of the act.
He and Duke remove their outer clothing during the ensuin
Because is not democrash? All peoples  created equal?
Hey, you been sneaking some reading  outside the frigging Bible!
I have great interest for America,  his peoples and his custom.
Good, because we got a fine old  American custom we want to teach  you. You know what these are?
He gives Ho-Jon two bottles. The boy looks at the labels.
Gin. I know, yes. (reads other label) Dry... (has trouble with the  word) ...vermouth.
EXT. MASH COMPOUND – MORNING Frank walks toward the tent from the direction of the  hospital.

INT. THE SWAMP – MORNING Frank opens the door and is taken aback by the sight of t two bottles on the table and Ho-Jon filling glasses held Duke and Hawkeye, who have climbed into their sleeping ba He is so disturbed he fails to shut the door.
Is that liquor?
Finest kind. We're training Ho-Jon  to be a bartender. Join us?
But first will you please kindly  shut the goddam door?
I don't drink intoxicants.
(to Duke) Christ Almighty, I think he means  it!
We been had.
I don't believe it's right for you  to involve a boy who's not seventeen  years old yet...
The door, Frank, the door! Where you  from anyhow, Alaska?
(closing door) Wisconsin.
Same general idea.
Frank proceeds to take off his outer clothing preparatory retiring.
Officer all sleep now, yes? And I go  wash clothes.
Right, Ho-Jon. See you later.
So long, Ho-Jon.
You make a mean martini, kid.
Ho-Jon goes out. Duke and Hawkeye settle back to enjoy th drinks but they both come bolt upright when they see Fran drop to his knees by his cot and begin to intone the Lord Prayer.
Our Father who art in Heaven Hallow'd  be Thy name. Thy kingdom come, Thy  will be done, On earth as it is in  Heaven...
Hawkeye and Duke find it hard to believe their eyes and e They never expected to see a grown man behaving as Frank now.
Give us this day our daily...
You ever caught this bread, and  forgive our syndrome before, Duke?
...trespasses as we forgive those  who trespass against...
Us. Lead us not into...
...No cases over the age of temptation  but deliver us eight. from evil. For  Thine is the kingdom, the power and...
...the glory forever. Amen. (raising martini  glasses) Amen!
(singing) Onward Christian soldiers...
(singing) Marching as to war. With the cross  of Jesus going on before. Christ our  Royal Master, leads against the foe.  Forward into battle...
(breaking off singing,  points to Frank) He ain't finished!
For a moment, before Hawkeye speaks, some of the words Fr is mumbling come through.
...And for our young men on the field  of battle, that they may return home  to their dear ones...
Come clean with us, Frank. Were you  on this religious kick back home, or  did you start to crack up here on  the post?
(ignoring him) ...And for our Supreme Commander  over here and our Commander-in-Chief  in Washington.
How long does the show go on, Frank?
Frank turns his head toward Duke while remaining in prayi position.
It gets longer all the time. Now I  have your soul to pray for, and  Captain Pierce's.
INT. HENRY'S OUTER OFFICE – DAY Sargeant Vollmer is working on some papers at his desk wh Hawkeye and Duke come in. They pass right by him and head for Henry's door.
Hey! That's a Colonel's office!
(hand on Henry's door) Ayuh. Just who we're looking for. (opens door) Henry, you got to do something!
LESLIE exits from Henry's office as they enter. INT. HENRY'S OFFICE – DAY Henry is at his desk. Duke and Hawkeye come in and seat  themselves in informal comfort. Both watch Leslie exit.
We've stuck it out for a whole week  now... Pretty girl.
We sure don't aim to cause any  trouble... Yeah, she seems to grow  on you.
You don't aim to cause any trouble –  But?
But we strongly suspect something  will happen to screw up this splendid  organization of yours if you don't  get that sky pilot out of our tent.
Your tent?
Yeah, maybe move that nurse in. She  don't seem the type to keep you awake  praying.
(pause) I have been in this Army a long time.  I know just what you guys are up to.  But there are limits...
We'll find out what they are when  you throw us out.
That's all the commitment you're  offering me? (to Duke) Or do you have some more extravagant  gesture of cooperation?
No, Hawkeye just said it all.
Except we forgot one other small  thing.
What's that?
The chest-cutter.
Yeah, that's right. (to Henry) You better get us a chest-cutter  before there's trouble.
This outfit needs somebody who can  find his way around the pulmonary  anatomy when the bases are loaded.
And it's the ninth inning.
Forget it. No Mash unit has a chest  surgeon and we aren't about to get  one. Your housing problem I'll give  some thought to in the next couple  of weeks.
Radar O'Reilly comes in with "Emergency" written all over his expressive face. He makes a hand gesture to Henry tha could loosely be construed as a salute.
Yes, O'Reilly?
How you, Radar?
They're running behind in the OR,  sir, and the Preop Ward is all jammed  up. Two choppers and three ambulances  full.
This is the most serious kind of crisis for the outfit, a Henry's expression shows it.
(to Duke and Hawkeye) You boys'll have to go to work early.
You fixing to add overtime to a twelve- hour day? The union ain't gonna like  it.
You work those kind of hours, you  got to have rest. Which you can't  get with somebody jabbering away on  a direct line to heaven.
(crisply) Major Burns will be out of your tent  in twenty-four hours. (to Radar) Tell them Captain Pierce and Captain  Forrest are on their way.
Radar goes out. Duke gets to his feet and Hawkeye makes a preliminary move toward doing so.
About that chest-cutter...
I'll try, d-d-dammit! You can't ask  any more than that!
We don't want any more than that. (following Duke out) Right now.
EXT. MASH COMPOUND – DUSK Hawkeye and Lieutenant Dish are walking close together in otherwise deserted area.
Cold?
He puts an arm around her without waiting for an answer. smiles at him fondly.
Even if I weren't.
Maria...
He kisses her and they cling together, standing outside a tent identified by a sign: "OFFICER'S CLUB."
Oh, Hawkeye, I don't think I could  stick it out these next few weeks  without you.
Hawkeye opens the door of the Officers' Club, looks in.
Nobody here.

He steps aside to let her precede him in. There is nothin inside except a pool table. She hesitates. He takes her i his arms again, this time pressing his hands against the  seat of her fatigue pants.
You understand why I still can't...
Ho-Jon appears in his line of vision, not hers.
Captain Pierces...
Hawkeye lets go of her, and they try to look like innocen strollers.
Hi, Ho-Jon. How they goin'?
Finest kind. Captain Forrests say  you better haul ass home quick. We  got new chest-cutter in our tent.

EXT. THE SWAMP – DUSK The wooden front of the tent has a new sign identifying i as "THE SWAMP." INT. THE SWAMP – DUSK First we see Hawkeye sitting on his cot, looking across t tent at the newcomer. Attached to the canvas wall behind is a photograph of his wife and two sons, aged four and t Next we turn our attention to Duke on the adjoining cot  (formerly Frank's). He also has a family picture on displ his wife, two-year-old daughter and an infant. Then we ge our first glimpse of TRAPPER JOHN, their new tentmate, ab 30, tall and very thin, his head pretty well hidden insid the hood of a parka. He is using cellophane tape to insta one of the popular nude photos of the day (such as the on of Marilyn Monroe that circulated so widely in the early  1950's). Completing the group is Ho-Jon, who sits on the floor,  silently taking in everything that is done or said. Finished with his decorating effort, Trapper reaches into the depths of his parka to produce a can of beer. He digs into the other side, finds an opener and opens the beer.  Then his head goes back inside the parka along with the c as he takes a swig from it.

(to Hawkeye) Now I got you for a witness, I'm  going to try again. So far all I  dragged out of him is he's from  Bahston and he's only been in the  Army two months. (to Trapper) Where were you when they drafted  you?
Home.
I mean, what were you doing? Were  you a resident or on a staff  someplace?
That's right.
Where?
Hospital.
Which hospital?
Back home.
Is there any reason why we shouldn't  know the name of it?
No. (a long swig of beer) Or why you should.
(to Duke) I think I've seen this nut somewhere. (to Trapper) Haven't I?
If you don't know what you've seen,  why should I?
Hawkeye is unsatisfied. He keeps staring at Trapper, sure he's seen him before.
(to Trapper) You ready to switch to a little tonic  we generally take us about this time?  Ho-Jon...
Ho-Jon goes to the table and takes a few ice cubes from a hospital ice-bag, puts them into the pitcher along with g and a dash of vermouth.
Don't you use olives?
Where you think you are, boy? They  probably never seen a olive in this  country.
Ho-Jon pours three water-glasses full of martini and star to distribute them.
(to Trapper) That's the front up the road a few  miles. We have to get by without  some of the comforts of home.
I like an olive.
He reaches into his parka, comes up with a bottle of oliv takes one out and puts it into the martini Ho-Jon serves  him. Then, as Hawkeye and Duke gape at him, he offers the the bottle.

INT. OPERATING ROOM – DAY There are two operations going on, one of them being a si procedure requiring one surgeon and one nurse. The other contrast is a very special event. Trapper is operating,  assisted by another surgeon, a couple of nurses, a corpsm and the anesthesiologist, UGLY JOHN BLACK. Beside these a participants almost all the nurses and doctors from both  shifts, including Duke, Hawkeye (with Lieutenant Dish), F and Henry, are in a circle around the operating table as  spectators. Trapper's job is repairing a lacerated pulmonary artery, some other delicate piece of surgery close to the heart a involving a large chest incision. We see enough of the pr to observe that it is gory and deep inside a critical are but necessarily it is the reactions of the people watchin especially Duke and Hawkeye, that tell us how tricky an  operation it is and how expertly Trapper is handling it. The sequence is silent except for incidental operating ro noises. Even Trapper's occasional terse instructions to his assis and his brief exchange with Ugly John are spoken too low us to hear. There are four stages to the action: 1. The beginning of the operation before an attentive  audience, drawn by their interest in the new man and by t fact that this is a surgical procedure they have never da to attempt. 2. Limited approval and professional respect for the assu with which Trapper plots his incision and starts working way to his destination. 3. Mounting tension as the crucial stage is reached. The  suspense reaches its crest during the few moments when Tr is doing the actual mending job to which all the prelimin have led. The faces of his colleagues express anxiety and hope that he can accomplish what he set out to do, and  accomplish it quickly enough to permit the patient to sur Henry, not certain of his own judgment, looks to Duke for confirmation, and Duke nods to indicate he thinks Trapper has the situation under control. 4. The tension breaks as Trapper finishes the job to his  satisfaction and begins, along with his assistant surgeon to close up. Henry's smile of relief is unsure and only  tentative until he catches Hawkeye's signal that the job been done to perfection.

EXT. MASH COMPOUND – DAY Trapper, Hawkeye and Duke emerge from the hospital in  fatigues. Some enlisted men are tossing a football around One of them makes a wild throw and the ball rolls to a st at Trapper's feet. He stops to look at it and the other t halt with him. Then very slowly, Trapper leans over and p up the ball, waving Hawkeye downfield. Hawkeye complies unquestioningly and when he is about thi yards away, Trapper whips a perfect pass into his arms.  Hawkeye just stands where he is, holding the ball, oblivi of the enlisted men who want it back, as Trapper and Duke continue toward him. Revelation jolts him with apocalyptic force.
Jesus to Jesus and eight hands around!  Duke, did I ever tell you how I beat  Dartmouth by intercepting a pass?
Sixteen times.

We didn't have a chance, little  Androscoggin College against the Big  Green, but there was this blizzard  and we held then nothing nothing  till the last twenty seconds. Then  this great passer of theirs let one  go, snow and all...
Lucky you didn't have your mouth  open or it would have gone down your  throat.

He's Trapper John! Only man in history  who ever found fulfillment in the  ladies' can of a Boston and Maine  Railroad car! When the Conductor  caught him in there with his Winter  Carnival date, she screamed: 'He  trapped me!' What have you been doing  since those days, Trapper?
What does he have to do? A score  like that, a man could just live on  his reputation.

The enlisted men, increasingly concerned about their foot are muttering mutinously to each other. Hawkeye is too ca away about Trapper's identity to notice this till Trapper calls it to his attention.
(to Hawkeye) Ball.
Hawkeye looks at the football and at the enlisted men, an finally getting the point, throws it back to them.
(relieved to find  another subject) What gives over there?

They look across the compound to the Shower Tent, behind  which an Army truck full of GIs has just pulled up. While Hawkeye and Duke explain what's going on to Trapper, and three of them move in for a closer look, we see the visit GIs drop one by one from the rear of the truck, pay their admission fees and take their places in the line leading to the strategically placed peep hole in the rear corner the tent.
Must be Painlees Pole Day in the  Shower Tent.
(to Trapper) You met him. Walt Waldowski, the  Dental Officer.
Nice guy, for an enamel surgeon.
What are they peeking at? Captain  Waldowski in the shower?
Part of him. Painless is the owner  and operator of the Pride of Hamtrack.  That's where he comes from...  Hamtrack, Michigan.
Best equipped dentist in the whole  goddam Army. Care to have a look, a  man with your background?
Way we hear it, the Pride is supposed  to have run up the highest lifetime  batting average ever recorded in  Wayne County.
EXT. SHOWER TENT – DAY Corporal Judson from Mississippi takes his turn at the  peephole. His speech is that of the rural southern black.
Ah'd purely love to see it angry.

INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye and Duke are working on a patient about whose cha their faces reveal extreme pessimism. The nurse in attend is Leslie. Hawkeye takes the patient's blood pressure and frowns at reading.
This kid looks like a loser. Maybe  we better get the bead-jiggler to  put in a fix.
(to Leslie) Call Dago Red.
INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Without interfering with the administration of blood and  other medical measures, Dago Red is just finishing giving last rites to the patient.

...May God remit unto thee the pains  of the present and future life, open  to thee the gates of heaven, and  bring thee to everlasting life. (makes the sign of  the Cross) May Almighty God bless thee, Father,  Son and Holy Ghost.
(taking patient's  pulse) Duke...
She wants him to feel it and he does, reacting excitedly.
Slowing down!
Hawkeye meanwhile is checking blood pressure again.
Going up. Nice work, Red.
INT. THE SWAMP – DAY Dago Red is the cocktail guest of the three Swampmen. Ho- sits in his usual place on the floor, following everythin that's said and refilling martini glasses wherever needed
There's sort of a built-in prayer  for the sick man to get well, but of  course that's not the basic intention.
I don't care about the intention. I  just know your Cross Action is a  plus on our side. I've seen it come  through four times.
And you've had a natural four times  in a row in a crap game. Right? Does  that mean...?
Not without lots of praying and  kissing the dice. (to Dago Red) It's a different ritual but it works  the same.
What do you think, Trapper?
Me? I was raised a mackerel-snapper...
Dago Red gives him a quick, intent look, which Hawkeye no
...But I turned in my knee pads.
Ho-Jon, give the Father some more  martini.
Just a taste, Ho-Jon. (to the group) I'd better get to the point... what  I came here for today.
You came because we asked you, for a  drink.
We wanted to tell you how you were  helping us with your fixes.

Well, sure, but I'm also worried  about Walt Waldowski – Painless. His  poker players got in an argument and  asked him for a ruling, and he said  what difference did it make, it was  just a card game.
It's obvious from the shocked reactions of the Swampmen t the priest couldn't have reported a more ominous symptom.
I guess I'm getting a toothache I  better have looked at.

INT. DENTAL CLINIC – DAY There is no activity around the dental chair, but the non poker game is thriving as Hawkeye enters, carrying a bott in a paper bag. The players are evenly divided between  officers (UGLY JOHN, MURRHARDT and a visiting HELICOPTER  PILOT) and enlisted men (VOLLMER, RADAR and JUDSON).
Take a seat, Hawk. We can use a fresh  pigeon.
Got to see the man about a tooth.  Where is he?
(to Vollmer) Call. With a pair of kings. (to Hawkeye, pointing  to smaller tent  attached) Inside.
Hawkeye goes on into Painless' private quarters.
(indignantly, to Radar) How can you call with one lousy pair?  Ought to be a house rule against  mind reading.
INT. PAINLESS' TENT – DAY Painless is lying on his back on the cot, staring blankly the ceiling. Hawkeye has poured drinks from his bottle an is sipping his, but Painless' remains untouched.
If a man isn't a man anymore, what's  he got left to live for?
Tell me the whole story, Walt.
There's this native broad works in  the laundry. I don't know if you've  noticed.
There's only one worth noticing.
You noticed. I wasn't going to fool  around over here. I've got these  three girls I'm engaged to back  home...
He indicates three photographs of young women, displayed  with equal prominence. Any one of them could make Miss  America.
But I had this feeling I ought to  make the effort. To test myself. And  I flunked.
What did you have to test, for God's  sake... the dental Don Juan of  Detroit?
Don Juanism is just a cover... I've  been reading up on it. (emotionally overcome,  turning away) I'm a fake, I'm a fraud, I've been  living a lie!
Moved by the intensity of his self-denunciation, Hawkeye  bends down close to Painless, puts a comforting hand on h shoulder.
Painless, you mustn't talk that way.  It's a lot of crap. Cover for what?
Homosexuality.
Hawkeye straightens abruptly, his hand rising from Painle shoulder as from a hot stove.
Now I know that's been my problem  since I was a kid. But it only caught  up to me last night.
You've been drawn to other males?  Since you were a kid?
No, never in the slightest.
Just in dreams?
Or in dreams either. I repressed it  completely. Classic pattern of  inhibition.
That's what you've been doing all  these years with every dame you could  lay your hands on? Repressing your  real self?
But it's all over now, and I can't  face it. Imagine if you found out  you were one, you wouldn't like  breaking the news to your wife. Well,  I got the same problem multiplied.
You don't have any problem. You've  got thirty good years ahead of you,  easy. Maybe you'll have to cut down  as you grow older, get along with  just two fiancees, but...
No, one thing I finally know for  sure, I'll never function with a  woman again.
INT. THE SWAMP – NIGHT Hawkeye is reporting to Duke and Trapper. Murrhardt and  Bandini are there, as well as Ho-Jon.
There ought to be a law against  dentists reading. Matter of fact, I  thought there was. Anyway, this is  an obsession. He can't be persuaded  out of it.
(appearing in doorway) He's comin' this-a-way! The jaw- breaker!
Y'all just act natural.
Get out the scotch, Ho-Jon. (to the others) Don't mention the sex thing unless  he brings it up.
A perfunctory knock on the door is immediately followed b the entrance of Painless.
How you, Walt? We was just fixing to  have a nightcap.
(to Ho-Jon) Pour one for Painless.
Ho-Jon serves drinks all around. There is a silence as ea of the hosts tries to think of a conversational opening.
I thought you guys ought to know.  I'm going to commit suicide.
This leads to another silence, broken by Trapper, who doe go so far as to stand up but leans way out from his sack grasp the dentist by the hand.
Miss you, Walt.
He said it for us all, Walt.
How about leaving me your record  player?
How do you figure to go? Forty-five  between the eyes?
Powerful sloppy.
Reliable though.
That's really what I came here for.  See what you guys recommend.
(as in a medical  consultation) Well, I'm sure my colleagues will  agree there are a number of dependable  measures for extinguishing the vital  forces.
Black capsule.
The black capsule. Finest kind. Thank  you, Dr. McIntyre.
What is it?
Easy, pleasant, never-miss ride.
In the direction you want to go.
You guys got any black capsules?
For a buddy we got whatever it takes  to stamp out the last spark of life.

INT. DAGO RED'S TENT – DAY The priest is sitting at his desk reading his breviary wh Hawkeye and Trapper enter. Trapper goes over to Red's bee supply, opens it and distributes three cans while Hawkeye greets their host.
How they goin', Losing Preacher?  What do you hear from the Pope?
You talked to Walt?
He's parted his moorings.
We're throwing him a Last Supper. We  came to invite you.
The Painless Pole plans to cross the  Great Divide tonight and we need  your help to straighten him out.
What do you want me to do?

Put in one of your fixes. Walt knows  he's loused himself with the Church,  but it's part of our plan to make  him think he has the keys to the  kingdom. Which he will think if you  grease the skids for him.
I don't think I can give absolution  to a man who's about to commit  suicide. It's a mortal sin.
What is, Red, the intention or the  act?
(confused) I believe it takes both. I'd have to  look it up.
Just use common sense. Your job is  preventing sin, and the way to do  that is give him your best Cross  Action.
Or you can let him knock himself  out. You personally'd be sending him  to his grave.
An eternal damnation.
(feeling cornered) I don't know. I'm not sure what the  Military Vicar's office would think...
They sure as hell won't hear about  it from us.

INT. DENTAL CLINIC – NIGHT The poker table, and dental chair have been removed to ma room for two long tables from the Mess Hall. At these a  sumptuous, candlelit, stag banquet is coming to an end. T guests are doctors, administrative officers, chopper pilo and enlisted men. Duke is on his feet, raising a glass of champagne in a toast. (All our male cast except Henry and Frank)
Y'all come here to say a final goodbye  to our old friend Walt. But maybe it  ain't so final. Maybe he's just going  on ahead into the Unknown to do a  little recon job for us all.

During this tribute the guests rise, their eyes on the gu of honor, who sits with his food untouched, a vacant  expression on his face. When Duke has finished and everyo has drunk the toast, they applaud and sit down again. Tra raps for attention and indicates Hawkeye, who rises.

I just got this one thing to say.  Nobody ordered Walt to take on this  mission. He volunteered, for certain  death. That's what we award our  highest medal for. That's what being  a soldier is all about.
Except for Painless himself, the gathering is deeply move by this thought, some of them to the point of tears. Agai Trapper restores order.
Only one man here can add anything  to that.

He looks to Dago Red, who stands up, dressed for the firs time in the priestly vestments he wears for Sunday Mass. walks to where Painless sits and there begins the viaticu (holy communion for those in danger of death).
Receive, my brother, this food for  your journey...

A coffin, borne into the room by two enlisted men while R is still speaking, is lined with blankets, equipped with pillow for comfortable reclining prior to the onset of de and furnished with mementos of Painless' earthly career: fresh decks of cards, a box of poker chips, a fifth of sc some basic dental instruments and the photographs of his  three fiancees. It is set down on the floor next to Painl who regards it with the first show of interest he has  manifested during the proceedings.
(bestowing the sacred  host) ...The body of our Lord Jesus Christ,  that He may guard you from the wicked  enemy and lead you into everlasting  life. Amen.
Red is making the sign of the Cross when Painless' curios asserts itself.
What the hell's that?
Coffin. Yours.
I'm not even dead yet.
You're a pretty heavy guy to lug  around. Be a hell of a lot more  convenient for everybody if you got  into the box as soon as you've taken  the capsule.

He produces and opens a small box, inside which, surround by pure white cotton, a black capsule is displayed like a rare jewel. Dago Red, meanwhile, preferring not to know w happens from here on, makes his way out.
(scrutinizing the  capsule) How do you take it?
(appearing at his  side with tumbler of  whiskey) With whiskey. A good swallow first  and a big one afterwards. Speeds it  into the bloodstream.
Painless takes the tumbler from him with one hand, the ca with the other. He downs a good-sized swig of whiskey, th with the capsule in front of his face, hesitates.
You guys sure this'll do the job?
We wouldn't give you nothing but the  best.
We stand behind all our work.
You want it straight? Medical history  records no instance of anyone taking  this particular prescription and  surviving.
Here goes nothing.
He pops the capsule into his mouth and washes it down wit large drink of whiskey. Hawkeye gestures to the waiting  coffin. Painless gets up and lowers himself into it.
How much time do I have?
Just about enough to say goodbye to  everybody. (announcing) Line up over here, men, if you want  to pay your last respects. Keep moving  and file on out when you're through.
I wonder, if Red's fix swings it for  me, what's heaven really like?
It's a bedroom where a man is always  at his peak and doesn't have to take  any time outs.
And all the angels are built like  Lieutenant Dish.
The Last Supper guests are filing by the coffin, bending to shake Painless' hand and murmur words of farewell.
Drink up, Walt. One for the glory  road.
He holds the glass to Painless' lips, helps him down the  rest of the whiskey.
INT. POSTOP WARD – NIGHT Hawkeye finishes checking a patient, looks to doorway and sees lieutenant Dish standing there. He crosses to join h
Thanks for coming, Maria. (takes her arm and  leads her through  exit) Sorry it had to be so late.
EXT. MASH COMPOUND – NIGHT Hawkeye and Lieutenant Dish walk from the Postop Ward.
I couldn't have slept tonight anyhow.
You're leaving tomorrow?
In less than twelve hours I'll be on  my way.
That's when the real strain starts.  Three weeks on a troopship. (embraces her) Poor baby.
(kissing him) Dear, sweet Hawkeye.
Though I guess who it'll really be  rough on is your husband.
You're on his side all of the sudden?
A man would be more considerate. He  wouldn't come home to his wife a  nervous wreck.
How would he avoid it... as if I  needed to ask?
It could be a purely impersonal thing.  What matters is the therapeutic value  of relieving your tensions.
You should have been a marriage  counselor. (drawing his head  closer to hers) But I'll show you what's wrong with  your theory.
They kiss passionately. Dish is shaken by it and that sho in her voice when she continues making her point.
Do you think anything between us  could be impersonal? Or pure? You  better forget logic, because you're  proving why I shouldn't go to bed  with you.
(after a moment of  massive internal  struggle) I didn't mean with me.
It takes a couple of seconds for what he has said to pene her consciousness. She looks at him incredulously.
You're asking for somebody else?
It happens to be a matter of life  and death.
A man is going to die if he doesn't  have my fair young body?

Precisely, Maria. Tonight you have  the same privilege that comes on  rare occasions to the chief executive  of some state or nation... the  privilege of restoring life, by one  tender act of mercy, to a doomed  fellow creature.

While he is speaking, a blue light goes on in a tent in t background. As they turn to see what is going on, four me carrying a heavy box approach the tent. EXT. BLUE-LIT TENT – NIGHT (OFFICER'S CLUB) At closer range the box is revealed to be Painless' coffi with the departed dentist inside it. The four men who car it into the tent are Radar, Judson, Boone and Seidman. Th tent doesn't have a wooden door like the Swamp, just a fl
EXT. BLUE-LIT TENT – NIGHT The four enlisted men carry the coffin, empty, out of the tent. Then Hawkeye and Dish appear, moving slowly toward tent as he continues to break down her resistance.
He should come to now for a while,  but he's got so much dope in him by  tomorrow he won't know fact from  fantasy.
You think he won't.
What do you care? You'll be on your  way to Japan.
I'm fond of Painless, and I'd feel  terrible if anything happened to  him...
It's your decision, Maria. I don't  want to high-pressure you.
I'd be crazy to think my virtue,  such as it is, was more important  than his life...
In fact I'd rather not try to  influence you at all. (opening tent flap) Let's just go in and take a look,  and then you think it through for  yourself.

INT. BLUE-LIT TENT – NIGHT The tent has been fixed up with all the resources at thei disposal – cushions, parachute cloth, mirrors and little  touches of elegance gathered from all over the post – to  resemble a luxurious bedroom on the home front. Lying in (the pool table) between clean, inviting sheets is Painle The boys have undressed him as we can see by his bare  shoulders. Hawkeye takes Dish by the hand and leads her t the side of the bed.
One last look at him... (raises sheet,  uncovering Painless  to the knees) ...still alive... (slips raised sheet  into Dish's grasp) ...the whole man.
Dish's eyes pop at what she sees. So astounded is she tha she doesn't notice Hawkeye has given her the sheet and ma off.
My God, Hawkeye, I never realized...  I never even dreamed... (becoming aware he's  no longer at her  side) Hawkeye! Hawk...

She finds he's disappeared altogether. She can't resist  turning her gaze back to the uncovered Painless. Then she drops the sheet. EXT. BLUE-LIT TENT – NIGHT The tent flap drops into place, continuing the movement o the sheet. Our attention is drawn up the front of the ten to its peak, which points firmly upwards.

EXT. THE SWAMP – MORNING There is the SOUND of a HELICOPTER overhead. Hawkeye emer from the tent to look at it, verifying that it is coming  from the peaceful south rather than the embattled north.  Then he sees Lieutenant Dish coming out of her tent, wear her Army uniform and followed by one of the enlisted men  carrying her bags. Hawkeye waves goodbye but Dish doesn't see him. Her face, seen up close, has a serene, faraway l neither happy nor unhappy, but enriched by experience. Hawkeye is not distressed by her failure to acknowledge h he understands it's a question of preoccupation and not a deliberate snub. He starts across the compound to the Mes Hall, noting that the helicopter is descending to land on the far side of the hospital. EXT. LANDING AREA OUTSIDE 4077TH MASH – MORNING There is a small welcoming party on hand, headed by Henry himself, to greet the passenger arriving in the helicopte When it lands the door is opened and HOT LIPS (as she wil soon be known) gets out smartly, which is the way she doe everything. Her official name is Major Margaret Houlihan she is tallish, willowish, blondish, fortyish, prettyish. She and Henry exchange salutes and then shake hands. The  others in the greeting party are out of the habit of salu and have to be reminded by a stern look from their Comman Officer. As Henry and Hot Lips, followed by the others, head for t hospital entrance, Lieutenant Dish appears with the enlis man behind her. She gets into the helicopter and he lifts her bags in aft her. A moment later the chopper is airborne again. INT. MESS HALL – DAY One of the first people Hawkeye sees in the officer's sec is Painless, who is eating an enormous breakfast with gre gusto.
Morning Painless. How they goin'?
Big day. Two jaws to rebuild.

INT. POSTOP WARD – DAY Frank is listening gravely to a wounded soldier's heartbe through a stethoscope. Standing by awaiting orders is Pri Boone. Frank has a disturbed reaction to the lack of vita signs from the patient.
(to Boone) Get me one c.c. of adrenaline and a  cardiac needle.
What's a...?
Never mind questions. Get them!

As Boone dashes off with no comprehension of the errand h is supposed to perform, Trapper, a couple of beds away, i the soiled fatigues he wears on nonoperating room duty, c see and hear what is going on. While he watches, Frank ch the patient further and establishes that he is dead. With disappointed sigh, he drops the man's lifeless arm and th the bedcovers back over him up to his neck. INT. OPERATING ROOM – DAY Henry is showing Hot Lips through the hospital and introd her to personnel. At the moment he is presenting Knocko.
Captain Williams, Major. (to Knocko) Major Houlihan is our new Chief Nurse.

Knocko holds out her hand in friendly greeting, and is  startled to find Hot Lips expects a salute instead. INT. POSTOP WARD – DAY Trapper, having observed Frank's recognition of the fact patient is dead, is unprepared for what the Major does wh Boone comes running back with a syringe, a small vial and ordinary hypodermic needle.
(anxiously) This what you wanted, Major?
(looking at vial) No, you idiot. I said adrenaline.  And a cardiac needle.
He turns back to the patient and goes all over again thro the same checking process he followed before.
(desperately) I'll ask a nurse!
It's too late. You killed him, Boone.

A ghastly look appears on Boone's face. He tries to say  something, can't get it out, and bursts into tears instea Then additionally ashamed of himself for this weakness, h runs out. Frank, deciding not to discipline the boy for t display of unsoldierly conduct, is proceeding about his  business when Trapper accosts him.
You got a moment, Frank?

He indicates the Utility Room, which leads off the Operat Room and the Postop Ward. When Frank assents, Trapper ope the door and ushers him in. INT. UTILITY ROOM – DAY It's a small room containing, among other items, a table  with a pot of coffee and cups which are available to medi personnel at all hours.
You all through work for the day?
Yes, I am. Why do you want to know?
Make sure you got time to sleep this  off.

He puts his whole hundred and thirty pounds behind a righ uppercut that lands squarely on Frank's jaw. At the same  instant the door from the Operating Room opens, and Henry gallantly makes way for Hot Lips to precede him.
This is the...
Frank drops to the floor, momentarily knocked out.
T-Trapper!... C-C-Captain McIntyre...  what the hell... ?
(staring at Trapper  incredulously) That's a captain?
Frank is coming to and could probably get back into the f by a count of eight if he had any desire to.
(to Trapper) What's going on? Who started this?
You mean who hit who?
Yes, that's what I mean.
I did. First and only blow. So far.
(getting up) He wouldn't have touched me if I'd  had my guard up. Let us settle this  between ourselves, Colonel. Alone.
What do you think I'm running, an  English boarding school? McIntyre,  you're under arrest. Confine yourself  to quarters, pending an investigation.
If you say so, Henry. But remember  my claustrophobia.
(to Hot Lips) I deeply regret this unfortunate  incident. We try to remember we're a  military organization.
I certainly would have thought so.
INT. THE SWAMP – NIGHT Henry is standing indignantly over Trapper, who is sippin beer in his sleeping bag. Duke, Hawkeye and Ho-Jon are  witnesses to the encounter.
(yelling) What's wrong with you?
I don't know. I must have lost my  punch. I didn't think the son-of-a- bitch would get up.
Stop acting like a colonel, Henry.  You know Trapper wouldn't sock him  without a good reason.
There's no reason good enough for  one medical officer to strike another.
That there Frank Burns is a menace.  Whenever a patient croaks on him  it's either God's will or somebody  else's fault.
This time he did it to a kid who's  simple enough to believe him. Why  don't you dump the mother, Henry? He  creates more work than he gets done.
I should fire him because he got in  the way of Trapper's fist? No. I've  put up with a lot from you guys, but  now I finally have to take  disciplinary action.
Christ. All of a sudden it's West  Point.
What are you going to do with him?
Well... (to Trapper) I was going to name you Chief  Surgeon... (to Hawkeye) To consult on both shifts, yours and  Frank's.
Hey, that's great, Henry! Good  thinking!
First decent idea you've had in a  month.
Now I'll have to wait at least a  week. If I announced it tomorrow,  after what our new Chief Nurse saw  this afternoon, they'd hear her  yelling from Seoul to Washington.

INT. MESS HALL – DAY Hot Lip's handsome face is relaxed into her most charming smile as she approaches Hawkeye at the table where he sit by himself having a late breakfast after a long night's w Hawkeye (like Trapper and Duke) no longer makes any attem at a proper military appearance.
Captain Pierce, would I be  imposing...?
Honey, nobody as pretty as you could  ever impose... please sit down.  Coffee?
He offers her some from the pot beside him, and she holds out a cup while he pours it.
Captain, I've been observing the  nurses on your shift. But naturally  your own opinion is more informed  than mine.

I'm glad you feel that way, Major,  because you see it's a team effort...  doctors, nurses, enlisted men... and  I feel responsible for my whole team,  and I want you to know I'm satisfied  with them.
All of them?
That's right. We work well together.
Major Burns is far from satisfied.
That don't surprise me. If you're a  good observer, you must have observed  by now that Frank Burns is a jerk.

On the contrary, I've observed he's  not only a good technical surgeon,  he's a good military surgeon. And  that includes how a man dresses and  how he bears himself and his sense  of what it means to be an officer in  the United States Army.
And his track record, that don't  count? Look, honey, when you watch  the two shifts try to notice which  one does the most work with the least  fuss.
I've noticed that both nurses and  enlisted men address you as 'Hawkeye.'
It's my name. Maybe that sounds silly  to you but...
That kind of familiarity is  inconsistent with maximum efficiency  in a military organization.

Okay, Major, honey. (pushes back his chair) I'm going to have a couple shots  scotch and go to bed. I'd normally  ask you to join me but obviously  you're a female version of the routine  Regular Army clown. And that turns  me off, so just leave my outfit alone  and we'll get along fine. (stands up to go) See you around the campus.
(icily) I wonder how a degenerated person  like you could have reached a position  of responsibility in the Army Medical  Corps.
Sister, if I knew the answer to that  I sure as hell wouldn't be here.
EXT. / INT. MESS HALL – DAY (SNOW ON GROUND) People are going in and out of the Mess Hall, when an  announcement comes over the public address system.

(over P.A. system) Attention, everybody. I have an  announcement. 'Effective today,  Thirteen April, Captain John S.  McIntyre, U.S. Army Reserve, is  appointed Chief Surgeon at 4077th  Mobile Army Surgical Hospital. Henry  B. Blake, Commanding Officer.' (informally, on his  own) Nice going, Trapper.
Ugly John and Captain Bandini shake Trapper's hand in  congratulations. The only two officers in the outfit who  don't like the news come out of the Mess Hall together: M Burns and Houlihan.
There's no point appealing to Colonel  Blake. They've got him bewitched.
No. The only thing to do is write  General Hammond. (knowing perfectly  well she has her own  tent) But it's hard to find a place around  here for a private discussion.
I have a tent to myself.
People will talk.
I don't mind. If we give them  something to talk about.
INT. HOT LIP'S TENT – NIGHT Hot Lips finishes reading the letter she and Frank have  drafted, signs it and stands up as she folds it and puts in a prepared envelope.
I think it's a marvelous letter.
We're a good team.
We think the same way.
It's supper time. (as casually as he  can say it) But you're not hungry are you?
Ravenous. What about you?
(trying to hide his  disappointment) Well, sure, if you are, Margaret...
Anyway, we want to get this letter  off.

He grabs her and kisses her and from her reaction we get clear picture of the kind of female she is. She responds the kiss fervently, pressing her lips and body against hi but the moment she decides to end it she switches right b to her businesslike manner.
The sooner it reaches him, the sooner  we can turn this into a tight military  outfit.

INT. MASH MAIN BUILDING – AT MAIL DEPOSIT BOX – NIGHT Frank deposits the letter in the box while Hot Lips stand by. Then they proceed on their way to the Mess Hall, unaw that they have been observed by Radar on the other side o the partition into which the mailbox is set. INT. MASH MAIN BUILDING – NIGHT Radar picks up the letter Frank deposited and reads the  address. INT. THE SWAMP – NIGHT There is a party going on. Present, in addition to the th occupants, are Painless, Ugly John, Bandini, Judson, Voll Ho-Jon, Boone, Murrhardt and Seidman. Radar enters, engag Hawkeye's attention and shows him the letter. Hawkeye gla through it, looks to Radar for confirmation and, getting tears up the letter. Meanwhile under Duke's leadership, a bedpan is affixed with adhesive tape to Trapper's head.
Hail to the chief! We-all got a  responsibility, men. He's crowned  like a king ought to be, but he can't  just walk to the Mess Hall by himself.  He has to be carried by native  bearers.
Good thinking, Duke. How about it,  Ho-Jon? Can you round up a few of  the boys?
I don't get what you mean, native  bearers.
Bear is the same thing as carry.
It's the other word I'm not sure.
(afraid of where this  is leading) Never mind. Forget it.
(simultaneously) A native is someone who is born in a  particular place.
And if I go to New York, the natives  there will carry me? I don't think  so.
I don't think so either.
I don't think I should have opened  my big mouth. Sorry, Ho-Jon.
(smiling) That's okay. Live a little, learn a  little.

INT. MESS HALL – NIGHT Frank and Hot Lips, sitting by themselves in a corner are disgusted, and the rest of the people there are mildly am by the spectacle of Trapper's entrance. The new Chief Sur still wearing his bedpan crown, is borne in on his cot by Hawkeye, Duke, Painless and Ugly John. They set him down break into song.

head_text.speaker/title: DUKE, HAWKEYE, PAINLESS AND UGLY JOHN

text: (singing) Hail to the Chief And King of all  the surgeons He needs a queen To  satisfy his urgin's.
(loudly, pointing at  Hot Lips) I'd like to try out that one over  there.
Very well, Your Majesty. (starting toward Frank  and Hot Lips) Congratulations, Frank. He picked  you.
No, no, that one.
Oh, you want to play it straight? (to Hot Lips) I guess I owe you an apology.
Her eyes blazing with indignation, Hot Lips gets up and s out. Frank follows her.
INT. HOT LIPS' TENT – NIGHT Frank is sitting next to Hot Lips on her cot with a sooth arm around her.
Godless buffoons, all of them.
(her hands on his  face, turning it  towards her) It's that disrespect for you, that's  what I can't forgive them.

Oh, I'm used to it. What makes me  sore is how they behave towards you. (pulling her into a  tight embrace) They ought to be grateful to have  you. (kisses her, his hand  vanishing beneath  her skirt) I certainly am.
(undoing one of his  buttons and sliding  her hand under his  blouse) And I'm grateful for you, Frank,  especially with those boors around.  We've grown very close in a short  time.
He kisses her around the neck and bosom, removing such of the clothing as gets in the way.
It isn't just chance, I'm sure of  that. God meant us to find each other.

Instead of lingering on a scene that threatens to become  pornographic, our attention is drawn down beneath Hot Lip cot, where a strange object is being inserted under the c wall of the tent. It is a microphone.
His will be done. (then, in excited  response to an  inflammatory move on  his part) Da-a-arling!
EXT. HOT LIPS' TENT – NIGHT Radar, who has just planted the microphone, lets a coil o wire spin out as he moves away.

INT. HENRY'S OUTER OFFICE – NIGHT Gathered here illicitly, in what is not only Sergeant  Vollmer's domain but the communication hub of the post, a Trapper, Duke, Radar and Ugly John. They are listening, o their own private speaker, to what is being said in Hot L tent.
(over speaker) Frank... Frank... Frank... Frank...  Frank...
What'd'y'all reckon he's doing to  her?
Casting her horoscope.
(over speaker) Give me your lips, love. Set me on  fire.
(to Radar) Plug it in, boy. We got no call to  be selfish with a show like this.

Radar accordingly transfers the lead from the microphone the outlet for the post loudspeaker system. EXT. ENLISTED MEN'S TENTS – NIGHT The occupants of one tent are engaged in a crap game, whi the men in the adjoining one are settling down for the ni They are all dumbfounded to hear Hot Lips' voice over the public address speakers.
(over speaker) I want you to make love to me all  night. I don't want anything to take  you away from me.

INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye is performing surgery on a patient, assisted by  Captain Bandini. Both doctors and Leslie, the nurse worki with them, have stopped to listen to the lovers' dialogue coming over the OR speaker.
(over speaker) Nothing can, with the Colonel gone.  I'm in charge tonight.
INT. HOT LIPS' TENT – NIGHT Frank is on top of Hot Lips and, though the details of th amorous activity are hidden under the covers, we can see  enough to know it is reaching a climax.
I like a man who is in charge.

Each word she speaks is instantly echoed on the speaker s so that the word "charge" is still sounding after she has finished saying it. She suddenly realizes there is someth wrong, though she doesn't immediately figure out what it
(disturbed) Frank...
Don't stop now! Please...
The word "please" is repeated so distinctly outside that, while Frank in his critical condition remains unaware of Hot Lips sits bolt upright, pushing him aside.
Wait a second...
I can't... couldn't.
EXT. FRONT OF THE 4077TH – DAY A Jeep driven by Henry pulls up near the hospital entranc from which Radar emerges to meet him. Leslie also joins t
Good morning, Colonel.
Morning, Radar. How were things?
Splendid, sir. No problems.
Morning, Captain.
Morning, Colonel.

INT. MESS HALL – DAY Hot Lips is finishing breakfast at a table with some of t other nurses. Frank is sitting near her but at another ta with a handful of male officers, including Hawkeye direct opposite him. Duke and Trapper enter together as Hot Lips rises to leav
(cheerily, to nurses) Morning, girls. Good morning Major.
(coldly) Good morning.
Hiya, Frank. Hiya, Hot Lips.
Duke and Trapper continue on their way to their table in officers' section. Frank reacts angrily and is about to g after Duke when Hot Lips touches his shoulder and speaks a low tone.
No, leave all the rowdiness to them.  Calm down, drink your coffee.

Hawkeye probably can't make out her exact words, but his  gaze follows her as she goes out the open door. The he lo at Frank, bending low across the table as if he, too, had something confidential to say, but actually speaking quit distinctly.
Tell me, Frank, is that stuff you're  tapping any good?

Frank reacts with such rage he can't speak for a moment. EXT. MESS HALL – DAY Henry, Leslie and Radar, passing by the Mess Hall entranc encounter Hot Lips on her way out. Her salute catches Hen by surprise, but he makes a quick stab at returning it th his attention is on what he sees through the Mess Hall  windows.
(to Radar) Hawkeye and Frank Burns. That's  encouraging.
INT. MESS HALL – DAY Hawkeye, who can see Henry outside (which Frank can't),  affects surprise at receiving no answer to his question.
I was just asking...
Shut up or I'll tear you apart.
EXT. MESS HALL – DAY
Can you make out what they're talking  about?
I can try, sir.
INT. MESS HALL – DAY
I only wanted to know what she's  like in the sack. Do those big boobs  hold up or are they kind of droopy?
EXT. MESS HALL – DAY
(to Henry) Hawkeye's asking the Major's opinion  on a point of anatomy.
INT. MESS HALL – DAY
Also I'm curious whether she's a  moaner or...
Say that again and I'll kill you.
EXT. MESS HALL – DAY
The Major wishes to have the question  repeated.
INT. MESS HALL – DAY
You know, does she go in for sound  effects...?

He keeps a wary eye on Frank while talking, and thus is a to duck the coffee pot Frank hurls at him. From where Hen stands in the doorway, this act of unprovoked aggression astonishing enough, for he can see Hawkeye innocently eat his cereal, but the Colonel is even more amazed when Fran follows it by springing across the table onto Hawkeye and raining blows on him. Hawkeye puts up no resistance but s covers his head and screams.
Help! He's gone mad! Help, somebody!

EXT. MASH COMPOUND – DAY Two MPs are dragging Frank in a straitjacket to an MP Jee They load him into the back and one of them gets in along him while the other takes the wheel. Watching the MPs drive off with their prisoner are Henry, Duke and Trapper.
Fair's fair, Henry. If I get into  Hot Lips and jump Hawkeye Pierce, do  I get to go home, too?
EXT. REPUBLIC OF KOREA ARMY INDUCTION CENTER IN SEOUL – D (SNOW IS GONE)

It is now February. A jeep with Hawkeye at the wheel, Ho- beside him, drives up to the entrance. Hawkeye gives Ho-J a final instruction as the boy gets out of the Jeep and g into the building. Hawkeye finds a place to park in the s Lieutenant Scorch is with them.
It was really nice of you to take me  along.
I didn't have much choice.
You really say the cutest things.
Yeah!

INT. KOREAN ARMY INDUCTION CENTER – DAY The locale is established by the presence of military  personnel in uniform and the fact that a KOREAN ARMY DOCT with the aid of one assistant, is examining in quick  succession a long line of naked young Korean boys. Ho-Jon turn comes up and we see how perfunctory the process is: brief overall scrutiny for visible defects, a blood press reading, and the application of a stethoscope to a few ke spots. Ho-Jon looks healthy and the doctor is startled by the unexpected reaction he gets on applying the stethosco to the boy's heart. He turns to check the blood pressure  figure which his assistant is about to record on the form has taken from Ho-Jon. Apparently the pressure is just as out-of-line as the  heartbeat, and the doctor feels Ho-Jon is ineligible for  military service.

(to assistant, in  Korean) We can't take this one. His heartbeat  is much too fast, and his blood  pressure is dangerously high. (to Ho-Jon) Have you ever seen a doctor before? (abruptly, to assistant) Wait a minute! What does it say there  about where he's been working? (takes Ho-Jon's form  and reads the  information for  himself; then, to  assistant) Get the check on his urine sample  right away. (to Ho-Jon) You'll have to wait around for a  while, young man. I need some more  information before I talk to you  again.

EXT. KOREAN ARMY INDUCTION CENTER – DAY Hawkeye, with Lieutenant Scorch, waiting in the Jeep, is  startled at being addressed by a stranger, whom he recogn as the doctor that examined Ho-Jon. Ho-Jon is with him.
(in English) You please excuse... (as Hawkeye turns and  sees them) I have been making examination of  this young man to find if he will be  soldier in our army.
Yes, I know. Hi, Ho-Jon. How did it  go?
I don't liking it at all, what I  hear when I listen to the heart. And  such a blood pressure for so young a  boys. Is frightening.
I'm sorry to hear that. You think  he's unfit for military service?
At first is no doubt. But then I am  seeing on his paper he work in  American hospital. And I think there  are so many drugs in such a places,  he could take some by mistake.
Why would he do that?

Who is knowing? But the drug I have  find in his urine is solving all  mysteries. By tomorrow will be gone  his fast heart and high blood  pressure. So I think maybe you will  like to tell him goodbye. Okay?
He gives Hawkeye a warm smile and leaves the two of them  alone. It's clear from Hawkeye's expression that he has n choice but to admit defeat.
Sorry, Ho-Jon. I didn't think they'd  be that sharp. But I'm still going  to start the ball rolling for you to  go to college in America when you  get out. My old school, Androscoggin.

EXT. OFFICERS' LATRINE – DAY It's a warm spring day in a climate much like the northea part of the United States. At first we see nothing but th latrine tent, which is identified by a sign. A couple of  small missiles propelled with considerable force strike t canvas, but it is only when they roll back to the ground  that we can identify them as golf balls. A closer look at the ground area reveals a dozen other balls scattered aro and then we see two Korean Houseboys appear from protecte places on the sides of the tent, looking carefully to mak sure there are no more balls coming, and proceed to gathe up those on the ground. During this action there is the S of a helicopter landing near the hospital. EXT. FIELD BEHIND OFFICERS' LATRINE – DAY The disreputability in clothes and grooming that has been increasing with each view of the Swampmen has reached an  extreme stage in the view we now get of Hawkeye and Trapp ALong with their soiled fatigue pants, Hawkeye wears a to dirty T-shirt of some unlikely color, Trapper a sport shi that looks as if he had picked it up in Hawaii on the way over and worn it ever since. Both are unshaven. Each has a well-equipped golf bag into which he now repla the iron club he has been using for the medium-range shot they have been practicing. Taking out drivers, they set t in the ground and, as the houseboys run up with the balls Trapper indicates they will be shooting down the longest  dimension of the field. After addressing the balls with a few practice swings, they deliver expert drives that are only in the 250-yard range but fairly straight in the int direction.
(pleased with himself) I came within about ten yards of  you. You know something, Trapper,  the way we been going, if we ever  got to see a real golf course again,  I bet we could burn it up.
As far as the greens maybe. I don't  know if my putting would come back  or not, without some practice.

The SOUND of the helicopter taking off again doesn't conc them till they realize it is headed directly toward them. comes down so close to them they step back to avoid the w from the propeller blades, which the PILOT keeps going as and Vollmer climb out.
(to pilot) That's him on the right.
That's Captain McIntyre?
(to Trapper) The Lieutenant's flown up from Seoul  just to find you.
You're Captain McIntyre?
That's what the Army calls me. Stick  out your tongue, take off your shirt  and tell me where it hurts you.
His face showing his bewilderment, the Pilot silently han Trapper a long white envelope and a large brown one. Trap tears open the white one, glances at the top copy of the  order it contains.
'...Proceed immediately to Kokura,  Japan...' (to Pilot) Do you know what this is about?
There's a GI there whose father's a  Congressman. A grenade went off in  training and they think there's a  piece of it in his heart.
(opening brown envelope) These his X-rays?

Yes, sir. Apparently some big chest  surgeon in Boston told the Congressman  the only man to take care of his son  was Captain John McIntyre. (his doubt undiminished) I suppose there could be more than  one doctor with that name...
Trapper meanwhile has held the X-rays up to the sunlight invited Hawkeye to look at them at the same time.
(looking back at  orders; to Hawkeye) General Hammond says I can take anyone  along I need to assist me. Want to  come?
Hawkeye uses the pretense of scanning the X-rays from ano angle to draw Trapper aside, so they can speak without th Pilot and Vollmer hearing them.
I'm not so sure the goddam thing's  in his heart.
'Course it isn't, but how many chances  do we get to go to Japan? With our  golf clubs.

EXT. AIRPORT IN KOKURA, JAPAN – DAY It is a bright, sunny afternoon in peaceful Japan. Hawkey and Trapper, in the same outlandish clothes, walk from th military transport plane in which they have made the trip from Seoul, and approach a car with "25TH STATION HOSPITA emblazoned on its side. The driver, SERGEANT GORMAN, is asleep. With their golf c slung over their shoulders, they get into the back seat.  Hawkeye pulls the door closed with the loudest possible B and succeeds in waking Gorman, who turns on them with out indignation.
Garrada there!
What?
Let me translate. I've had some  exposure to the language. The young  man is from Brooklyn and he wants us  to vacate this vehicle.
(to Gorman) But weren't you supposed to meet the  surgeons who are going to slice up  the Congressman's son?
You guys are the quacks?
You betcher ever-loving A, buddy- boy.
Poor kid. Goddam Army.
But besides the operation, we've got  to get in at least eighteen holes of  golf.
So let's haul ass, Sergeant.
Goddam Army.
But he starts the engine.

INT. ARMY CAR – DAY There is silence between Sergeant Gorman and his passenge as the military hospital comes into view. But something e comes into view in the distance at the same time: the  unmistakable contours of a golf course.
Look.
Beautiful. What do you think? Should  we stop and play nine holes now and  operate on the kid later? If he's  still alive.
Goddam Army.
I think we ought to operate first,  no frills, get through it on the  double. Then we'll be nice and relaxed  on the course.
Good thinking.
Goddam, goddam Army.
They are coming to a stop in front of the hospital.
INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL – DAY A PRETTY WAC sits behind a reception desk doing a job so  utterly routine she doesn't even look up from her magazin when Hawkeye puts a question to her.
Where's the Congressman's son at,  honey?
Ward Six.
But then she does glimpse enough of their costumes to tak full look, and her reaction indicates clearly that she is not prepared for unkempt, unmilitary-looking men carrying golf bags.
Hey you can't go in there! Who are  you?
I'm the pro from Dover and this is  my favorite caddie.
Well, you can't go in. No till you  tell me your business and I check  with Colonel Merrill's office.
(relenting) Well, if you must know...
But Trapper has meanwhile made a feint toward the door, t which the Pretty Wac responds by rising and interposing  herself in his path.
