(to Hawkeye) Hold it. If this soldier enforces  her own orders. I'm ready to take  her on. Anxious. Single combat.

He moves toward the girl, who holds her ground staunchly  till they are almost in contact. Then she takes a step ba and continues to take one step backwards for each one of in her direction. When they get close to the door, her  resistance collapses entirely and she scurries back to he seat at the desk, where she grabs the phone as Trapper an Hawkeye march through the door.
(into phone) Colonel Marril's office.

INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL – DAY All personnel, American and Japanese (who, like the Korea at MASH, do the menial work) react in surprise to the sig of Trapper and Hawkeye making their way around a few corn till they find Ward Six.

INT. WARD SIX – DAY Two golf bags are propped against the foot of the  Congressman's son's bed. Trapper listens closely to the b chest while Hawkeye bends down to his ear to reassure him WARD NURSE hovers near him, not actually cooperating with them but not defying them either.
(to Congressman's son) Don't worry, son. That's Captain  McIntyre, and he's the best chest  surgeon in the Far East and maybe in  the whole U.S. Army. He'll fix you  up fine. Your daddy saw to that.
Just like we thought, it's a routine  problem. Nurse, who's in charge of  operating room preparations?

By the time he has begun his question to her, the WARD NU has spotted someone approaching of whom she is in obvious dread. And it is at this figure that she points by way of answer: a firece looking NURSE CORPS CAPTAIN.
Sh-sh-she is.

Anticipating that a major confrontation is about to take  place, Trapper and Hawkeye decide to keep it away from th patient's beside. Accordingly they pick up their golf bag and go to meet the advancing Captain.
What are you hoodlums doing in this  hospital?
(politely) We're surgeons, ma'am, we're here to  work. All we want is our starting  time.
You can't even look at a patient  here till Colonel Merrill says it's  okay. And he's still out for lunch.

(quietly) Look, Mother. I want to go to work  in one hour. We're the pros from  Dover and we figure to crack that  kid's chest and get out to the golf  course before it's dark. So find the  gas-passer and tell him to premedicate  the patient. Then bring me the latest  pictures on him; the ones we saw  must be forty-eight hours old by  now. And tell the kitchen to rustle  up some lunch. Ham and eggs'll do;  steak would be even better. And give  me at least one nurse who knows how  to work in close without getting her  tits in my way. (as she hesitates) You're going to have to move quicker  than that. I said an hour.

INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL OPERATING ROOM – DAY CAPTAIN E.B. (ME LAY) MARSTON is the anesthesiologist at 25th. Wearing gown, cap, and mask, he is busily at work checkin the Congressman's son to make sure he is properly  anesthetized. At that moment the doors open and in come  Trapper and Hawkeye, also wearing OR outfits, as are the nurses who stand by waiting for them. Trapper looks  questioningly at Me Lay, who answers with a nod that all ready.

INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL OPERATING ROOM – DAY The atmosphere in the OR is tense. Hawkeye is maintaining proper traction on the clamp that holds the lung in place while Trapper concentrates on removing the fragment.
Got it.
I demand an explanation!
COLONEL MERRILL, Commanding Officer of the hospital, has  stormed through the OR swinging doors in full military un without any antiseptic precautions.
(to circulating nurse) Get that dirty old man out of the  operating room!
I'm Colonel Merrill!
Beat it, Pop. If this chest gets  infected, I'll tell the Congressman  who did it.

To everyone's astonishment, including the Colonel's, it w He turns around and walks out without another word. Most  affected of all by Hawkeye's audacity is Me Lay, who reac with a sharp look in Hawkeye's direction and then by pick up his anesthesia chart and writing, in the space labeled "First Assistant," the name "Hawkeye Pierce."
Okay, I'm closing up. Everybody relax.
(to Hawkeye) May I have the surgeon's name, please?
He's the pro from Dover and I'm the  Ghost of Smokey Joe.
Save that crap for the rest of the  clamdiggers back home.

Both surgeons stop working in their surprise. Hawkeye loo at the anesthesia chart and sees where Me Lay has written his name. Then he takes a closer look at Me Lay himself, what shows of him between his cap and his mask.
(to Trapper) Did I ever tell you about Me Lay  Marston?
Your high school friend who went  around saying 'Me lay, you lay?' to  all the young females in the  community. As I remember, you said  it was quite a successful approach.
Well, he wouldn't score more than  once in seven or eight tries, but  the important thing was he didn't  waste time socializing. Anyway,  Trapper John, this is Me Lay.
The real Trapper John? The one who  threw you the famous pass and went  to greater glory on the Boston and  Maine Railroad?
The one and only.
Proud to know you, Trapper. Like to  shake your hand if you'll hurry up  and get that chest closed. (looks around to make  sure the nurses can't  hear) You still working the trains?
Planes mostly. May take a crack at  rickshaws. How does the direct  approach work over here?
I been out of action since I got  over here five months ago.
You don't go after the local scrunch?

I'm too busy, actually. Not for the  Army, of course, but where I live.  Dr. Yamachi's New Era Pediatric  Hospital and Whorehouse. I'm serious.  The guy has this crude hospital for  kids and a whorehouse on the side to  finance it, all in the same building.
INT. SURGEONS' DRESSING ROOM, 25TH STATION HOSPITAL – DAY Hawkeye and Trapper have washed and put their golf practi clothes back on. Me Lay is dressed in fresh fatigues with Captain's bars.
(to Me Lay) What do you do in the joint besides  pimp?
That's about the only thing I don't  do – that I'm built for. I inspect  the girls and take care of some of  the kids in the hospital. Sometimes  I tend bar and act as bouncer.
A CORPORAL enters with the manner of a messenger from on  high.
Captain Pierce? Captain McIntyre?  Colonel Merrill wishes you to report  to his office immediately.
Tell him we'll think about it. (to Trapper) I suppose we do have to reach some  sort of understanding with the old  boy.
(to Me Lay) What's the bastard really like?

(for the Corporal's  benefit as well as  theirs) Colonel Merrill is a veteran of twenty- five years in the Regular Army, a  soldier first and a doctor second. A  member of several patriotic  organizations, he believes it's  America's God-given mission to  maintain a foothold for freedom on  the Asian mainland.
That bad? (to Hawkeye) But I guess you're right. We might  as well see him. (reaches for golf  bag, to Corporal) Got any caddie carts?
What?
Trapper just slings his golf bag over his shoulder with a sigh, as does Hawkeye. Me Lay, meanwhile, has written a f words on a scrap of paper.
(to Corporal) Never mind.
(hands paper to Hawkeye) The address of the N.E.P.H. and W.  Why don't you meet me there when  you're through golf for drinks and  dinner and whatever strikes the fancy?
Mine's already been struck, and it  doesn't have to be very fancy.
(to Corporal) Lead the way.

The Corporal does so and they follow him out. INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL – DAY Hawkeye and Trapper come out of the dressing room after t Corporal and follow him down a corridor. Then they realiz to their surprise that there are two other soldiers follo them who have been stationed outside the dressing door. T invitation from the Colonel is getting to seem less casua every moment. INT. COLONEL MERRILL'S OUTER OFFICE – DAY A SECOND LIEUTENANT and a Sergeant seated on opposite sid of a desk look up with interest as Trapper and Hawkeye co in with escorts fore and aft.
These the prisoners?
Yes, sir.
Hawkeye and Trapper exchange looks.
They can wait in the Colonel's office.  He'll be back in a few minutes.

The Corporal opens the door to the Colonel's empty and qu luxurious office. Trapper and Hawkeye go in with their go bags. INT. COLONEL MERRILL'S OFFICE – DAY Trapper and Hawkeye enter, the door closing behind them, look around. It is a long time since they have seen  surroundings like these, with Western upholstered furnitu pictures on the walls and high quality wall-to-wall carpe It is this last feature that attracts Hawkeye's attention He squats down to feel its texture and with a look invite Trapper to do the same. Trapper is also impressed with th smoothness of the surface, and without having to exchange word about it, they each find a putter and a golf ball an start lining up targets for their brief sorely missed put practice.
INT. COLONEL MERRILL'S OFFICE – DAY The Colonel comes in militarily, which is the way he make all his entrances.
You men are under arrest!
Quiet! Can't you see I'm putting?
I'll have you...!

Please! (completes a putt,  walks over and picks  up ball) Face it, Colonel, you don't have us,  we have you. Your boys blew this  case, we bailed you out. We figure  we ought to hang around a day to  check the Congressman's kid, and we  also figure to play some golf. So if  that's okay with you, we got a deal.
And if it isn't, why don't we call  Washington on your telephone? You  tell your story, we'll tell ours.
(picking up his clubs) When you make up your mind, get in  touch. The golf club is probably the  best place to leave a message.

Trapper has also taken his golf bag, and the two of them  walk out serenely together. The Colonel supports himself his desk as he makes his way to his chair and sits down t absorb the shock to his system.

INT. JAPANESE GOLF CLUB PRO SHOP – LATE AFTERNOON The shop features an assortment of Western style golfing  attire, all about two decades behind the times. Trapper i holding a pair of 'plus fours' in front of him to test th size. The GOLF PRO looks on with the studied approval of dedicated salesman everywhere; Hawkeye with amusement.
These the longest you've got?
Wonderful. They are looking like  they are made for you.
Hawkeye has discovered a pair of knee-length argyle socks which he exhibits to Trapper.
We got to have these to wear with  them. (glances out window) You know, by the time we get all  this stuff on, it'll be practically  dark.

Two GIRL CADDIES enter the shop while he is speaking. The are very young, not more than seventeen, dressed in slack They see Trapper and Hawkeye's golf bags and start to sli them over their shoulders.
(agreeing) Yeah, maybe we ought to... (sees caddies) Hey, who are they?
Your caddies. But perhaps it is  becoming too late to start.
(walking over to  caddies for closer  look) Not at all. (touches the prettier  one under the chin  to raise her downcast  head) What's your name, honey?
Come on, Trapper. We got to forget  golf for today.
I don't know why. As long as it's  light enough to see your caddie.
(to Golf Pro) What's the age of consent in this  country?
Which? I do not know what you mean.
Never mind. (to Trapper) Let's take one sport at a time. The  place for tonight's is the New Era  Pediatric Hospital Et Cetera.

INT. DR. YAMACHI'S N.E.P.H. & W. – DINING ROOM – NIGHT Trapper and Hawkeye, dressed in kimonos, are sitting Japa style on the floor with Me Lay around a low table. Three  girls serve them attentively, doing everything for them e actually feeding them. A girl named MICHIKO takes away a plate that Trapper has  left virtually untouched and puts a bowl of thick soup in front of him. The second girl serves soup to Hawkeye and Me Lay, and th third brings in a large bowl of rice.
Soup? Rice? What are we doing,  beginning all over again?
No, we had a clear soup to start.  This is a thick one and you ought to  taste it. There's nothing like it  back home.
How can I taste it now? We've already  had like twelve courses.
You are not wishing to eat more? I  bring you most special plum brandy.
I don't want it. I don't want to  eat, I don't want to drink. (reaches out and grabs  Michiko's ankle) All I want...

There is a KNOCK on the door, followed immediately by the entrance of a Japanese nurse, who indicates an urgent des to speak to Me Lay. Me Lay gets up and listens to what sh tells him in an undertone. Trapper meanwhile has succeede in pulling Michiko off her feet, and makes clear the gene direction of his intentions by sprawling out on the floor with her in his embrace.
(to Hawkeye and Trapper) Can you guys take one minute to look  at a kid for me?
Now?
(to Me Lay) Why can't you look at him?
I have but well, you know, I've been  mainly an anesthetist a long time  now and... well, I'd like you guys  to take a look at him.
What's the story?
Well, one of the girls got careless  and two days ago she gave birth to  an eight-pound American-Japanese  male.
What's wrong with him?
Every time we feed him, it either  comes right back up or he coughs and  turns blue and has a hell of a time.

(releasing Michiko  and sitting up  reluctantly) We don't have to see him. Call that  halfassed Army hospital and tell  them to be ready to put some lipiodol  in this kid's esophagus and take X- rays.
But it's ten-thirty at night. We  can't get military personnel out for  a civilian. A foreign civilian.

Don't give them any unnecessary  details. Just say the pros from Dover  are on their way with an emergency.  And you'd better get the OR cranked  up because I got a feeling you're  going to pass some gas while I help  Trapper close a little bastard's  tracheo-esophageal fistula.

INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Three OR nurses are at work getting things on order when swinging doors open and Me Lay, carrying the two-day-old  baby, enters, accompanied by Hawkeye and Trapper. Nothing has led the nurses to expect an infant patient, and they distinctly taken aback.
Where did that baby come from? Is  that what you got us up for?

Yes, ladies, that's why we got you  up. Me Lay, put him down there... (indicating operating  table) ...and get ready to start giving him  the anesthetic. (to nurses) We stumbled on this deal. We didn't  want it but we don't see how we can  walk away from it, no matter whose  rules are broken. This baby has no  legal right to be taken care of in  an Army hospital, though his father  was probably an American soldier.  But he's going to die if we don't  fix him now, tonight. So what about  it?
Let's get going.
Me Lay places the mask attached to his gas container on t baby's face ans starts to administer a carefully limited  quantity.
This time I will not be intimidated!
He has come into the OR while he is talking, and he is so menacing that all preparations are halted while he finish his pronouncement.

I command that this improper and  illegal use of Army facilities cease  immediately. Twice you men have forced  me into appeasing your aggression by  threatening me with what you'll say  to a certain Congressman. Well, I  don't care what you tell him or anyone  else! I don't care if it costs me my  command and my whole career in the  Army. On this point I stand as a  matter of principle, as unshakable  as the Rock of Gibraltar.
Me Lay? Trapper?

Moving in concert, Hawkeye and Trapper grab Colonel Merri and drag him over to Me Lay's end of the operating table. Lay takes the anesthetic mask from the baby's face and cl it firmly on the Colonel's. The Colonel struggles for a w but they manage to hold him and pretty soon he is quiet.
Is he out?
Like the Rock of Gibraltar.

INT. DR. YAMACHI'S N.E.P.H. & W. – HALLWAY – NIGHT Trapper, Hawkeye and Me Lay are half-dragging, half-carry Colonel Merrill along a corridor, and girls, including Mi and the others we have seen before, have come out of thei rooms to watch.
He's coming to.
Let's get his clothes off quick.

INT. DR. N.E.P.H. & W. – BEDROOM – NIGHT Colonel Merrill is stirring on the bed as Hawkeye and Me remove the last item of his clothing. The Colonel opens h eyes but he is still too drugged to have any idea where h is or how he got there.
Okay, Michiko.

Michiko moves toward the bed, removing the kimono which i her only garment. At the same time Hawkeye grabs a camera which is all ready for use with a flashbulb attachment an starts to take a series of shots of the Colonel and Michi both naked in the bed. The Colonel reacts to the intermit bursts of light.
What the hell's going on?
Please, you no worry, sweetheart.  Just keeping close.
(after five or six  shots) All right, that's plenty. You can  put your clothes on, Colonel.
Michiko reaches for her kimono and puts it back on as she gets out of bed. The Colonel sits up, still a bit dazed b becoming more aware of what's happening all the time.
I've been framed!

That's what they all say. But I have  photographic evidence here that you're  a lecherous old man and a disgrace  to the uniform. However, I won't  even develop the film if your people  watch that baby we operated on like  he was the Congressman's grandson.  Which for all we know he may be.
INT. DR. YAMACHI'S N.E.P.H. & W. – HALLWAY – NIGHT Michiko joins Me Lay.
Where is Captain McIntyre? I am  waiting so long for him.
Me Lay open a bedroom door, revealing Trapper fully dress and sound asleep on the bed.
Give him a few hours, Michiko. Right  now he couldn't get up a flight of  stairs.
Michiko's answering smile indicates superior feminine wis in these matters. She goes into the room, closing the doo behind her.

INT. WARD SIX. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL – DAY Hawkeye, dressed in the Japanese adaptation of the well- dressed American golfer of the 1930's, and carrying his g bag, is at the Congressman's son's bedside. He looks at t boy's chart and then at the patient himself, finding both them quite satisfactory. INT. HOSPITAL ROOM – DAY Trapper, similarly outfitted with individual variations o his own, has just examined the baby they operated on. He  writes out some instructions and gives them to a nurse. T he picks up his golf bag and goes out to a corridor where Hawkeye is waiting for him. They start to walk toward the hospital entrance, finally  ready for a few hours of relaxation on the golf course.
(over loudspeaker  system) Captain Pierce and Captain McIntyre!  Please contact the message center.  Captain Pierce and Captain McIntyre!
They look at each other with foreboding.
It couldn't be good news.
By joint unspoken agreement, they quicken their pace in t same direction. Then their resolution falters.
(to a passing nurse) Where's the goddam message center?

INT. 4077TH MASH – LATE AFTERNOON OR facilities are being utilized to capacity. For the fir time we see Henry himself in surgeon's working dress, win up an operation. Completing his work, looking tired and  anxious, he walks through the crowded OR to the Preop War which is also jammed up with cases awaiting surgery. Lesl comes to meet him.
What's the lineup, Major?
Six cases ready for surgery, sir,  and four more that just need a little  more blood or a little more time for  the antibiotics to take hold.
I guess we can handle them, if there  aren't any six o'clock choppers.  Every time they fly while it's still  daylight, they've got wounded that  can't wait.

EXT. LANDING AREA OUTSIDE 4077TH MASH – LATE AFTERNOON Henry's watch says a minute or two after six o'clock. Onc more, as at the beginning, he is standing outside the  Admitting Ward with Radar, listening for helicopters comi from the north. Radar, straining his superhearing to list reacts unhappily to a sound neither we nor Henry can catc
Chopper coming in, Colonel. Two of  them, I'm afraid.
Damn.
(a puzzled look) And another one, but it's from the  south. (looking south) There.

Henry looks eagerly to the south as the COMBINED SOUND of three helicopters becomes audible and quickly mounts in  intensity. EXT. SKY TO THE SOUTH – DAY A helicopter (the type that came from Seoul to pick up Tr and Hawkeye, rather than the Air Rescue Squadron ones tha bring the wounded from the front) approaches the landing  area and starts to make its descent. There is a golf bag  full of clubs attached to each of its pods.

INT. ADMITTING WARD – DAY Trapper and Hawkeye, conspicuous because they are still i their golf costumes, are among the surgeons checking the  newly arrived wounded. More cases are still being brought from helicopters and ambulances, mainly on stretchers, a under their own power assisted by a Medical Corpsman or t This is really the most hideous face of war; the mangled  bodies and limbs and faces, the expressions alive with pa and dulled by shock, are more terrible than any number of quiescent corpses. Trapper finishes examining a man and s to Hot Lips.

This one goes right to the OR. Tell  Duke to do him ahead of the busted  spleen. (moving on to another  patient, a Korean) And this kid can't wait. I'll take  him myself, before I get to that  ruptured diaphragm.
Captain... (securing his attention) 'This kid' is a prisoner of war.
Yeah?
It's an American boy's rupture you're  supposed to close.
Listen, we get a deluge like this,  just deciding priorities on a medical  basis is hard enough. So never mind  the side issues.
INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT A few days later. Duke is working deep inside a belly wit new young surgeon, CAPTAIN LAPHAM, assisting him. Lapham  glances at the patient's face.
Duke...

Duke looks, too, and the patient's eyes are enough to tel him the job he's doing no longer has any function. After almost superfluous check of the heartbeat, Lapham closes man's eyes. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye, with Ugly John handling the anesthetic, is diggi out pieces of metal from a face that will never quite loo like a face again. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Trapper, with Painless filling in as anesthesioloigist, i working in close to a patient's heart. Suddenly all the l in the OR go out. This is not an unprecedented event, and one by one three corpsmen appear in different locations a the operating table with flashlights whose combined beams make it possible for Trapper to carry on. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT With the electric light restored, Duke and Lapham are at  work on another case, removing several feet of small bowe no longer useful to the owner. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Henry and Murrhardt, with Scorch assisting, are amputatin an arm. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT A dead patient, face covered with a sheet is removed from operating table by two corpsmen. Immediately two other  corpsmen bring a stretcher to the other side of the table and unload a new patient onto it. Ugly John and a nurse s to prepare him for surgery. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye, with Knocko helping, is sewing up an incision wh we can see is in the area of the groin. Dago Red comes by
Nice looking kid. Going to be okay?
He'll live if that's what you mean.  But somebody better be around when  he comes to and finds out there's  nothing left between his legs.

INT. ADMITTING WARD – DAY A few days later. A new group of patients is being brough in on stretchers by corpsmen. Trapper and Duke are examin an unconscious Negro private. Trapper looks at him with  special attention to the eyes. The right pupil is dilated and fixed. Duke meanwhile checks his pulse and blood pres
Pulse, slow, very little pressure.
Look at that right eye.
Epidural hematoma?
I don't know what else. You've been  that route a little, haven't you?
Not enough to be a pro.
He moves to another case. Duke continues to examine the  private with particular attention to the right side of th head. The more he observes, the more alarmed he becomes.
(to corpsman) Into the OR! Right now.
He runs ahead of the stretcher through the Preop Ward. At the entrance to the OR he runs into Knocko.
Quick, Knocko, get me gloves, knife,  hammer, chisel, Gelfoam and a drain.
INT. OPERATING ROOM – DAY Knocko finishes saving and cleaning the right temporal ar of the unconscious private's head, and Duke wastes no tim making an incision down to the bone.

Okay, give me the hammer and chisel.  There are drills you can make nice,  neat holes in the skull with, but we  ain't got none. (taking hammer and  chisel, fortifying  himself for the act) So here goes.

He pounds the chisel into the private's skull and keeps a it till he cracks his way through. Blood flows out in a  torrent. Duke pulls his tools away and just watches. Very quickly he is rewarded by the sight of a torrent diminish to a dribble.
What happens now?
We sew him up.
He stuffs Gelfoam down into the bleeding site, puts in a  rubber drain and starts to sew the skin back together wit silk sutures.
INT. OPERATING ROOM – DAY The private is moaning and stirring restlessly on the tab as Duke finishes closing the incision and Knocko takes th Patient's pulse.
Pulse is way back. Nearly sixty.
We took the pressure off his brain.  You know, Knocko, this boy might  just make it, and if he does you and  me ought to be ready with a story.
What do you mean?

One thing everybody knows for sure  that don't know hardly anything else,  is how delicate any kind of brain  surgery is. So I certainly wouldn't  like it if there was somebody going  around saying all I did was crack  him on the head with a hammer and  chisel.

INT. ADMITTING WARD – DAY Hawkeye is examining a young PRIVATE FIRST CLASS who is i shock, semiconscious and saturated with mud over his whol uniform, hair and skin. There is a muddy, bloody bandage  around his neck.
(to a corpsman) Get that bandage off so I can see  what the hell's underneath.

He moves on to the next stretcher. The corpsman undoes th bandage and pulls it away. The Private First Class turns head to the left, and blood spurts two feet into the air  from a hole in the right side of his neck.
Mama, Mama! Oh, Mama, I'm dying!

The blood continues to gush as the people in the immediat vicinity watch in fascination. As it comes down again if  falls on the PFC's face and into his mouth. He reacts by  coughing, spraying his audience with blood. Hawkeye runs  back and sticks his index finger down the hole, blocking the severed artery and stopping the flow of blood.
(to corpsmen) Bring him to the OR right on this  stretcher. I can't take my finger  out. Somebody find Ugly John and get  his ass in there.
They are already in motion toward OR, Hawkeye moving alon beside the stretcher with his finger in the hole. On the they pass near Leslie.

This one is urgent, Les. Start  somebody cutting off his clothes.  Tell the lab to come in with a couple  of pints of low titre O, and type  and cross-match him for five or six  more. Get somebody to do two  countdowns and start the blood. Come  to think of it, get somebody to start  rounding up donors, and send some  cowboys to Seoul for all the goddam  blood they can get. And get that  miserable gas-passer in here!
(at OR entrance) I'm here.

Good. Get him asleep and a tube in  him if you can. His common carotid  is cut and I can't do anything with  the son-of-a-bitch jumping all over  the place. (to Leslie) Find somebody to help me. I got to  keep a finger on this or we lose  him, and I can't get it clamped with  my left hand.

INT. OPERATING ROOM – DAY The PFC has been transferred to an operating table withou Hawkeye losing his finger pressure on the artery. The clo have been cut off him, and Ugly John has both blood and  anesthetic going into him, the latter through an intratra tube. Hawkeye has a scalpel in his left hand and with it enlarges the wound around his right index finger. Then he tries to slide a Kelly clamp down his finger into the wou to clamp the artery but he can't manage it lefthanded. He looks desperately around the OR only to observe that e surgeon and nurse is fully engaged, including Henry and H Lips. Ugly John is having a hard time fulfilling his dual function as it is, and can't possibly take on another. Ha tried again with the clamp and fails, and then, to his gr relief, there appears within in his peripheral vision as concentrates his attention on the PFC's neck, a male figu gowned, capped, masked and gloved. It doesn't matter to  Hawkeye which of his colleagues it is; he just tells him  what assistance he needs from him.
Grab this Kelly, ride it down my  fingers and we'll have this mother  under control.
The newcomer, though Hawkeye doesn't realize it, is Dago  Red. Following instructions, he takes the clamp and inserts it the wound.
What do I do with it Hawk? This is a  little out of my line.
Didn't recognize you, Red. When you  get the clamp all the way down, open  it as wide as you can and see if you  can close it on the artery.
Dagor Red obeys these orders cautiously. When he widens t clamp and starts to close it again, he has the satisfying sensation of feeling something substantial, and seizes it vigorously.
I got it! I got it!

But what he has grabbed with the clamp is Hawkeye's finge and Hawkeye, by reflex action, pulls it out to where we c see it with the clamp grasping it. The blood starts to sp again and Hawkeye goes back into the wound, but this time with his left index finger.

You got my finger for Christ's sake.  But maybe I can do better with my  right hand. (inserts a retractor  into wound, puts the  working end of it in  Dago Red's hands,  taking back the Kelly  clamp) Pull it toward you. More. Good. (rides clamp down his  left index finger  and this time he  closes it on the  right place) There. That does it for now. (to Ugly John) We'll keep him right where he is  till Trapper John can give me a hand  sewing that artery back together.

EXT. LANDING AREA OUTSIDE 4077TH MASH – LATE AFTERNOON Two helicopters descend to the ground, and corpsmen start unloading the wounded. Also visible are a couple of ambul that are being unloaded. Henry and the three Swampmen hav stepped outside the Admitting Ward entrance to watch. The are all haggard, unshaven and groggy, but Henry, the olde is the one who shows the strain the most.
Fifteenth straight day there've been  six o'clock choppers. How long can a  battle go on?
You got to relax, Henry. Since the  deluge started, you been working in  the OR and running the outfit, too.
Best thing you could do for all of  us is grab some sack time.
(calling) Radar!
Radar appears as usual on the instant.
Yes, sir? I've been trying to persuade  the Colonel to take some rest.
Well, stop persuading, just make  him.
(to Duke) Yes, sir. (to Henry) Come along, sir.
Henry is so fatigued he allows himself to be led away by  Radar.
Believe me, Henry, outside of us, no  one'll even know you're gone.

INT. PREOP WARD – DAY Here the more seriously wounded of those brought into the Admitting Ward are getting transfusions, have had Foley  catheters inserted in their bladders and/or Levin tubes i their stomachs, and have their X-rays on display on wires front of each cot. Trapper, Hawkeye and Duke are checking them to establish priorities. They reach the last cot, on which Ho-Jon is lying, attended by a Corpsman we haven't  seen before.
This kid is pretty bad.
Out of habit Hawkeye looks at the X-ray first.
For you, Trapper.
(looking at X-ray) Okay, but I'll need you to help.  Duke, will you take that belly back  there? The Australian?
Duke turns back to undertake his assignment. Trapper and  Hawkeye continue to study the X-ray.
It's in pretty deep.
Yeah, and he's lost a lot of blood.  I'm afraid it's hit more that just  the lung.
Ho-Jon opens his eyes and smiles at the sight of his old  friends.
(to Ho-Jon) You'll be okay, boy.
I know. I got the best there is.  Captain Pierce and Captain...
Christ, it's Ho-Jon!
Hiya, Ho-Jon. You got a piece of a  shell in your chest, but we'll take  it out as soon as you've had more  blood. Hey, Radar!
Radar, passing through the ward, comes over in response t the summons.
(to Radar) Has that A-negative come from Seoul?  We'll need some in the OR.
There isn't any. We keep ordering  and they don't deliver.
We got to have at least one pint.  It's for Ho-Jon.
Radar reacts in surprise and looks toward Ho-Jon's cot.
INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye is assisting Trapper in making the incision in Ho Jon's right chest. Ugly John is giving the boy additional anesthetic.
If we squeeze him through, I'm going  to get him into Androscoggin College.
How about squeezing him through into  Dartmouth? If all he wants to do is  catch lobsters, he can learn that  here.
Dartmouth's too big and too expensive.  If he's as good as I think he is, he  can move into the big league later.  But Androscoggin first.
(studying the incision) We'll need room. The sixth rib goes.
Never mind the conversation. Do it,  Dad.
You aspirate the blood from the chest  cavity. Damn, there's more of it  than I thought.
(preparing to use  suction device) If we don't get that pint, he's in  trouble.

EXT. AND INT. HENRY'S TENT – NIGHT Radar, followed by an associate lab technician, enters He tent. Henry is snoring away in deep sleep. Gently Radar straigh Henry's right arm and deftly injects Novocaine over a vei Henry stirs.
(mumbling in sleep) Not now, honey. Gobacksleep.

The lab technician tightens the sleeve of Henry's T-shirt serve as a tourniquet, and Radar expertly inserts a needl into the vein and starts extracting blood into a pint  container. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye has finished aspirating the blood. Trapper reache down into the wound.
(triumphantly) I got it. Here, feel. In the cava.
He takes his hand out and lets Hawkeye put his in.
I don't feel anything.
Oh, Jesus.
He indicates that he wants to feel again. Hawkeye withdra his hand and Trapper puts his back in again.
I can't feel it now either. The mother  must have gone in.
I don't get it.

It was in the cava and the hole sealed  itself off. I must have jiggled it  just enough to turn it loose. I can't  feel it in the heart or the right  pulmonary artery. So it's in the  left pulmonary artery.
What do we do?
We'll have to close this hole and  make one on the other side.
Be kind of rough on him if there's  no blood. Why don't we close up and  sit on him a couple of days?

Sure, that's the right way... at  John Hopkins or someplace. But how  do we know there won't be even more  of a jam-up a few days from now?  Maybe we won't be able to get to him  when we want to. Maybe the goddam  thing'll erode the artery when  nobody's looking. Our best shot is  now.
Radar comes up to the operating table with a container of blood.
A-negative. I've cross-matched it.
I though you said we didn't have a  drop.
I found a doner.

INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Trapper has exposed Ho-Jon's left pulmonary artery. Duke Hawkeye are assisting him by applying traction to the tap on either side of where Trapper is now cutting the artery so that there is only a small flow of blood from the inci Trapper brings out his hand and displays the tiny metal  fragment which is the object of their efforts.
(to Ugly John) How is he?
Nice.
(to nurse) Arterial silk.
He starts to sew the artery back together.
The artery is joined again.
(to Hawkeye and Duke) Ease off on those tapes, and let's  see how much it bleeds. (sees a few drops of  blood come through  incision) How is he?
Nice.
Boys, we're home free.
When will he be able to write?
What's he got to write, for God's  sake?
An application to Androscoggin  College.
INT. HENRY'S OFFICE – DAY Henry is on the phone. Hawkeye, Duke, Painless and Radar  wait eagerly for the news.
(into phone) Colonel Blake here.
INT. GENERAL HAMMOND'S OFFICE, 325 EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY HAMMOND, a one-star general, has a major and a lieutenant colonel with him as he talks to Henry.
(into phone) I got news for you, Henry. You've  been so concerned about that battle  for Old Baldy. It's all over.
INT. HENRY'S OFFICE – DAY Henry nods happily to the others to tell them that the wo is favorable.
(into phone) Thanks, General. Thanks for calling.

He hangs up and turns to the others to pass on the Genera exact words. INT. GENERAL HAMMOND'S OFFICE, 325 EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY The General wasn't through talking and didn't expect Henr to hang up at that point. He is quite startled, in fact,  because he has been saving the most important piece of  information for the end.
(to major and  lieutenant colonel) He didn't wait to hear who won.

EXT. FIELD NEAR RIVERBANK – DAY A very hot day in late August. Standing all by itself in empty field is a sign on which some fairly careful carpen and lettering work has been expended. It reads: "38TH PAR

CAMERA PANS to the river, where Trapper, Hawkeye and Duke are lying on their stomachs, naked or nearly so, on air  mattresses. The heat from which they seek relief is obvio intense, and they are pampering themselves further with t ice-filled drinks. On the riverbank near them stands one  empty cup and one half-full bottle of Pimms No. 1 Cup, an all three surgeons are more noticeably drunk than we have previously seen them.
She had this shiny black hair piled  up on her head, but later on she let  it hang loose and I'll be damned if  it didn't come all the way down to  her ass.
I've always had a hankering for blonde  pussy myself. My wife's hair is a  wonderful golden yellow, and this  time of year it gets even lighter.
I guess that's why you go for Hot  Lips Houlihan.
You know damn well I nearly puke  when I look at her. I don't even  think she's a real blonde.
How can you say a thing like that  about an officer in the United States  Army?
I not only say it, I'll back it up  twenty buck's worth.
You got yourself a bet, Georgia boy. (to Trapper) You're a witness.
Okay, I'm a witness, but how do you  prove who's right?
There's only one way.

EXT. SHOWER TENT – NIGHT Twelve hours later. The shower tent is simply an ordinary Army tent enclosing a row of showers supplied by a water  tank on a high platform in back of the tent. Duke and Haw are working under cover of darkness to loosen each of the stakes that secures the tent to the ground around it.
EXT. THE SWAMP – DAY The following afternoon. Trapper and Hawkeye sit in chair outside their tent, glasses in hand, still on their tall, hot-weather drink kick. Trapper looks at his watch.
It's five minutes into nurses' shower  hour. Where are they?
They're coming.

EXT. MASH COMPOUND – DAY The Swamp is at the end of the officers' row nearest the  nurses' tents, so they have a good view of the women as t emerge from their quarters dressed in bathrobes and carry towels, shower caps and bars of soap. The first two to ap are Knocko and Lieutenant Scorch. Next, from her own priv tent, comes Hot Lips.
Hey, Knocko, I got those pictures  you promised to look at of my kids.  You too, Wilma. It won't take a  minute. (to Hot Lips politely) You can see them too, if you want.
No, thank you. I'm not the slightest  bit interested.

She continues on across the compound and enters the showe tent. Knocko and Lieutenant Scorch come over to the Swamp while Hawkeye goes inside to find the pictures. Then two more n emerge from a tent and head for the showers. Trapper gets and saunters over to intercept them. EXT. SHOWER TENT – DAY The door of the tent is closed behind Hot Lips, and after moment there is the sound of water being turned on. Then attention is drawn to the peak of the tent, to which a th scarcely visible strand of wire has been attached. The wi is drawn taut and runs across the peak of the barbershop  tent next door and down the far side of it to where Duke  sits on the ground operating a sort of windlass upon whic the wire is wound. He turns the crank with a quick burst energy. Back at the shower tent the force of the wire pulls the c tight, the loosened stakes come out of the ground, and th whole tent is whisked right off its center pole, revealin Hot Lips nude under the shower. EXT. BARBERSHOP TENT – DAY Duke abandons his machine and moves to where he can get t crucial view of Hot Lips. The he calls across the compoun to Hawkeye.
Okay, Yankee know-it-all! Pay up!

INT. HENRY'S TENT – DAY Hot Lips, in her robe, her hair still wet from the shower carrying her towel and shower cap, is expressing her wrat forcefully to Henry, ignoring the facts that he is in bed and that Leslie is in bed with him, which explains why we have never seen anybody make a pass at her.
This isn't a hospital, it's an insane  asylum! And it's your fault because  you don't do anything to discourage  them!
What do you expect me to do?

Put them under arrest! See what a  courtmartial thinks of their drunken  hooliganism. It started with their  calling me Hot Lips and your letting  them get away with it. You let them  get away with everything! And if you  don't turn them over to the MPs now,  I'm going to resign my commission  and...!
Oh, g-g-goddamit, Hot Lips, resign  your ggodam c-commission!

EXT. FRONT OF 4077TH MASH – NIGHT Two days later. An Army car bearing the single star of a  brigadier general drives up to the entrance. The sergeant the wheel jumps out and open the rear door for General Ha and his aide, a captain.
(to aide) Tell them I want to talk to all the  officers on the post except those on  emergency duty.

INT. MESS HALL – NIGHT Most of the officers of 4077th Mash are assembled to list to General Hammond. Henry and Hot Lips are both in the fr row but separated by some distance and not looking at eac other. All the Swampmen are on hand.

...These are very serious accusations,  and without prejudging the charges  against him, I am suspending Colonel  Blake from all his duties during the  investigation, which I will conduct  myself. I will also serve as your  Commanding Officer during that time.  I shall be calling on a number of  you for your individual testimony on  the points at issue.

Thank you. Carry on. INT. DENTAL CLINIC – NIGHT Hawkeye, Duke and Painless are playing poker with a Briti a Norwegian and an Australian officer. It is close to two o'clock the same night. General Hammond opens the door an looks in, doesn't like what he sees and steps inside. All six players are immediately aware of his presence but dec to act as if they weren't.
(to British Officer,  who is dealing) Gimme three.
At ease. Captain Pierce, you have a  seriously wounded patient for whom  you are responsible. Yet I find you  in a poker game.
You betcher ass, Dad.
What?
One to the dealer. (to Hawkeye) You're the opener.
Check.
Pierce! That soldier requires  immediate attention. I'm a surgeon  and I know.
You betcher ass, General.
I'll wager a dollar.
I fold.
See the bet.
Me likewise.
Hawkeye and the Australian throw in their hands.
Are you going to take care of your  patient or are you going to play  poker?
King-high flush.
Painless and the Norwegian throw in their hands, and the  Englishman pulls in the pot.

(to the general) I'm going to play poker until three  a.m. or until the patient is ready  for surgery. However, if you'd like  to operate on him yourself right  now, be my guest. I get the same  dough whether I work or not.
I want to talk to you, Pierce.
There's nothing to talk about,  General. You take the case yourself  or join me at three o'clock. Either  way you're liable to learn something.

The General is far from pleased with the disrespect accor him, but as the poker players start a new hand, he decide against making an issue on terms selected by Hawkeye. Ins he turns around and goes out.
INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Ugly John is attending a Korean soldier on the operating  table with a belly wound. The OR clock reveals that the t is 2:55. Hawkeye and Seidman look in.
He's practically there.
(to Seidman) Please ask General Hammond to join  us.
INT. SURGEONS' WASH-UP ROOM – NIGHT General Hammond joins Hawkeye at the scrub sink, prepared take part in the coming operation.

General, at one-thirty when I checked  him last, this guy had had less than  a pint of blood, and he'd lost two  or three. His pulse then was 120 and  his blood pressure was about 90.  Now, at three o'clock, he's had three  pints of blood. His pulse is 80 and  his pressure 120. His collapsed lung  has been expanded and he's had a  gram of terramycin intravenously. We  can operate on him safely and we  should do it quickly, but we don't  have to do it frantically or  carelessly.

INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye has been doing the repair work in the patient's b with General Hammond functioning as a largely nonparticip assistant. The incision is still open with sections of bowel on whic repairs have been done still exposed.
Now, General, I'm going to sandbag  you. Do you think we're ready to get  out of this belly?
Obviously you don't think so, and I  don't know why.

Well, Dad, we haven't found any holes  in the large bowel. They've all been  in the small bowel, but the smell is  different. I caught a whiff of large  bowel, but it ain't staring us in  the face, right?
Right.

So if it ain't staring us in the  face, it's got to be retroperitoneal.  And that, along with the look of the  wounds, makes me figure he's got a  hole in his sigmoid colon that we  won't find unless we look for it.
He has been working all the time he has been talking, and now, after a little more manipulation within the incision is able to indicate the perforation he has hypothecated.
And there it is.
I'm impressed, Pierce. Naturally,  the kind of job I have, I don't get  much chance to keep up with what  goes on in the OR.

Neither does Henry Blake. But I'll  tell you what makes him the best  C.O. you've got in any of your  hospitals. He leaves all the medical  decisions to the men who do the day- to-day work and understand what  meatball surgery is.
INT. THE SWAMP – DAY The following day. General Hammond is having a drink with Hawkeye, Trapper and Duke. Ho-Jon keeps the glasses full.
It certainly isn't Henry's fault Hot  Lips Houlihan doesn't like her name.
Or her figger.
She's so square she's even against  our having a football team.
This stirs the General's curiosity, but Duke speaks befor he has a chance to ask his question.
You don't think we'd be speaking up  for a goddam Regular Army colonel,  do you, if it wasn't important?  Begging your pardon, General. I  forgot.
(to Hawkeye) Football?
Anybody you replaced Henry with  couldn't last. We guarantee that.
I didn't know you had a football  team.
Well, it's still pretty much in the  talk stage.
We had a team at the 325th Evac last  fall. I coached the boys myself.
I think I heard about that.
Now we're working out a schedule of  the outfits we're going to play this  year. We all chip into a pool and  make bets.
Must be fun. But the point we want  to make about Henry...
(rising) I'm sure we could find a date for  your team. Why don't I take it up  with Henry? (exiting) Thanks for the drink, boys.
After the General has left, the other two Swampmen look a Hawkeye uncomprehendingly.
Where the hell we going to get us a  football team?
All three of us played for our  schools. And there are at least four  other guys...
But he's got five times the man-power  to draw on.
We can balance that by getting  ourselves a ringer. Henry has to say  he needs a neurosurgeon and put in a  specific request for Dr. Oliver Harmon  Jones.
Never heard of him.
Sure you have, only as 'Spearchucker'  Jones.
The nigra boy with the Philadelphia  Eagles?
He only lasted one season.
On account he got caught in the doctor  draft. He was a surgical resident  playing semi-pro ball weekends when  the Eagles signed him.
How come nobody knows about him? And  you do?
I worked with Spearchucker my first  month over here, at the 72nd Evac in  Taegu. Most of the colored guys know  who he is but they're not talking  because he asked them not to.
So what makes you think he'll play  for us?
We'll cut him in on the bets we make.  And still have enough profit to send  Ho-Jon to college.
Might make kind of a social issue,  not having any other Negro officer.
He can move in here with us.
Now wait a minute, Hawkeye. I come a  long way, learning to put up with a  couple of crazy Yankees, but...
Don't tell me about your problems,  boy. Explain them to Ho-Jon.
INT. HENRY'S OFFICE – DAY Henry, nervous at what he thinks is going to be his showd with General Hammond, is startled by the General's unexpe proposal.
If we had closer relations, there  wouldn't be any misunderstandings.  That's where a football game would  help. Between your outfit and mine.
A football game?
Special Services in Tokyo are all  for it. They say it's one of the  main gimmicks we have to keep the  American way of life going here in  Asia.
But what about Major Houlihan?
You mean Hot Lips? Screw her.
N-n-no thanks, G-General.

EXT. LANDING AREA OUTSIDE 4077TH MASH – DAY It is September. A helicopter descends to the ground in t familiar location and, as on earlier occasions, Medical  Corpsmen come from the hospital to aid in unloading it. B this time the cargo, instead of wounded men, turns out to boxes which the corpsmen rip open and which contains foot uniforms: black shoes, cardinal red jerseys, white helmet and white pants.

EXT. FIELD BEHIND OFFICERS' LATRINE – DAY A day or two later. Fifteen men are wearing uniforms from the chopper load. Practice at this point is confined to  kicking and passing the three footballs at their disposal and the uniforms still look clean and new. Trapper is a g passer, Hawkeye is a better-than-average receiver, and Du punts well, but generally speaking, the balls are dropped more often than they are caught, and the overall effect i pretty ragged. Among the other players are Vollmer, Ugly  John, Boone, Painless and Judson. On the sidelines watchi are Henry, with a whistle tied to a piece of rubber hospi tubing around his neck, and, in uniform, SPEARCHUCKER, a  very big, broad-shouldered black man in his early thirtie
If I can make a suggestion, Coach.
The way I run an organization, any  man in it has the right to speak his  mind.
In that case, here are ten basic  plays. I think that's about all this  bunch can handle.
He hands Henry ten sheets of paper, on each of which a ru or pass play is diagrammed down to the finest detail.
Thank you, Spearchucker. I'll  certainly take a look at these. Where  the hell did you ever get that name?
I used to throw the javelin.
Hawkeye catches a pass from Trapper and runs with the bal right to where Henry and Spearchucker are standing.
Listen, we look pretty lousy out  there, right?
Well, for college players that have  been out of training seven or eight  years...

I'm thinking about how we can make  more money. (to Henry) Suppose we bet only part of our dough  and keep this big animal out of the  game the whole first half and let  them roll up some points. Then you  could bet the rest of our bundle  between the halves and get the General  and his friends to give us some real  odds.
It's a nice idea. I mean it has style.
It's the only way we can make enough  to put Ho-Jon through Androscoggin.

EXT. ATHLETIC FIELD, 325TH EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY It is November. The Mash team, in uniform, comes out of t quonset hut assigned to it as dressing quarters. Already the bench toward which the players head are a few support including Dago Red, Knocko and Leslie. Radar is also ther serving as water boy. Spearchucker has a blanket wrapped over his head and held together at the chin to eliminate the chance of his being recognized as he looks over their opponents, who now file out of their quonset hut. The first notable thing about them is that they number tw five as opposed to a total of fifteen in uniform for the  Mash team. Second is the even more discouraging fact that two of the one black and one white are enormous, bigger than  Spearchucker. The uniforms are orange and black.
Those two big guys were tackles on  the Cleveland Browns, and the redhead  played halfback with the Rams.
They can't do that to me!
The bastards outconned us.
I think we could still have a chance.
If you start the game instead of  waiting, you mean?

No, let's stick to that strategy  till we see whether you boys can do  two things. The first is get that  halfback out of the game. He had one  year with the Rams before the Army  got him, but he didn't play too often  because he's one of those hot dogs.
What?

When he sees a little running room,  he likes to make a show... you know,  stutter steps and cross-overs and  all that jazz. Also he never learned  to button up when he gets hit, so if  you two can get a good shot at him  once, you can hurt him.
But we'd have to break his leg or  something to keep him out of the  game for good.
Not necessarily.
As long as there's a pile-up, we can  do our bit to encourage his permanent  withdrawal from the contest.
It's a technique Ugly John and I  worked out in case something like  this came up.
(gazing across at  opposition tackles) Look at the size of those two beasts.
I don't think I could hurt one of  them with a sledgehammer.

You can make them run. They've got  the occupational disease of oversized  ex-athletes. They're carrying thirty  pounds extra apiece. So we run  everything wide, wide, wide... make  them move more then they want to on  every play.
EXT. ATHLETIC FIELD, 325TH EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY The Mash team is lined up to kick off, which is Duke's  function. There is only one official, a REFEREE, dressed in convent white.
The pro halback is playing safety.  Kick it to anybody else.

Duke accordingly kicks the ball about thirty yards and an to his left. But the player who takes it on the thirty-ya line simply runs to his left and back a little toward his own goal line in order to hand it to the RAM HALFBACK as charges downfield from his safety position. He sidesteps, straight-arms or otherwise eludes all eleven of the Mash  players and runs unimpeded for a touchdown. A few moments later he kicks the ball over the bar for the point after  touchdown.
(screaming from  sidelines) Stop him! Stop that man!
(as they line up to  receive) Sure, you just blindfold him first  and tie him to a stake.

Duke is the one to receive the kickoff, which he takes on the ten. He runs it back about twenty yards, dodging several enemy tacklers, then sees the black tackle from Cleveland beari down on him. Duke runs back and forth sideways a few time not gaining any ground but making the other man move.
Hawkeye!

He throws a lateral pass to Hawkeye, toward whom both tac from Cleveland now run. Hawkeye leads them almost from on side of the field to the other, then reverses direction,  keeping them on the move till he sees a chance to throw a lateral to Trapper.
(from the bench) That's the stuff! Run the hams off  those big hogs!
Trapper returns the ball to Duke, who manages to make a c of yards forward and a lot more sideways before the Ram  halfback cuts him down from the rear. The Mash team goes  into its first huddle.
(to huddle) Okay, don't give them a chance to  get their breath. Hawkeye wide to  the right.

They are near the sideline to their left, playing a winge formation. Trapper takes the ball from Vollmer, the cente runs back as if to pass but really gives it to Hawkeye at left half as Hawkeye goes by him in a wide sweep that tak him all the way to the right sideline with the two Clevel tackles in pursuit. Hawkeye then cuts in quick and tries to get by them but o of them brings him down for a gain of no more than two ya On the next play Trapper really goes back to pass, but hi blockers are of no use against the pro tackles, whom he s descending on him. Trapper starts running straight back f a while, then makes a dash to the right followed by a das to the left. He is almost tackled again, and his only rou of escape is back toward his own goal line.
(from the sideline) Throw it! Throw it!

Faced with a loss of about twenty-five yards, Trapper spo Hawkeye in the area of the line of scrimmage and whips th ball to him. Hawkeye catches it but there are tacklers all around him he goes down almost immediately for no gain on the play.  Moving faster than they have to in order not to give the  opposition any rest, the team huddles.
(to huddle) Wide to the left. Duke, you're the  pacesetter this time.

They go into action again. This time Trapper, taking the  ball from Vollmer, gives it to Duke, who makes a feint at off-tackle play, then turns back and into a wide end run  instead. Duke is still a good ball carrier by college  standards and he has little trouble shaking off the amate who try to tackle him, and is thus able to make it a runn duel with the professionals. When they finally nab him, h is no more than two or three yards ahead of the scrimmage line, but the ex-tackles from Cleveland are visibly panti and wishing they hadn't allowed all that extra poundage t accumulate. On the fourth down, of course, they have to p Duke goes back to receive the ball from Vollmer at center
Don't try to get it far down. Kick  it up high so we can get there and  surround that son-ofa-bitch.
Yeah, if I can.

He does a good job of it. The kick is high enough so ther are several red jerseys around the Ram halfback when he g under it. He raises his right arm for a fair catch. The would-be Ma tacklers, including Hawkeye and Trapper are frustrated. T array themselves defensively while their opponents have a huddle and line up to take the offense.
(to Duke and Trapper) Let's get him this time. I don't  think they've got anyone else who  can carry the ball.

As Hawkeye anticipated, the opposing quarterback slips th ball to the Ram halfback, who starts to go wide of the ta sees Hawkeye, untouched by blockers, closing in from the  outside, and makes his beautiful cross-over to cut back i At the same time he is hit at the knees by Hawkeye, and h by Duke. And there are quite a few other Mash players in immediate vicinity, Trapper and Ugly John in the forefron so that a lot of weight is piled up on top of the flashy  halfback. A close look at Ugly John reveals him to be reaching insi his jersey and under a shoulder pad, from which he extrac a hypodermic needle. With the skill of an expert  anesthesiologist he pulls up the sleeve of the tackled an stunned halfback, and plunges the needle into his arm. The Referee meanwhile is indignantly pulling at the Mash  players on top of the pile and orally expressing his  disapproval.
Get off the guy! He's tackled. You  don't all need to jump on.

The Mash players quickly remove themselves. Duke and Hawk are the last to get up. Remaining on the ground is the fo halfback for the Rams, still firmly clutching the ball bu looking as if he needed to get a lot of air into his lung His captain, the white pro tackle, takes one look at him speaks to the Referee.
Time! Time!

The Referee blows his whistle to stop the clock. The capt waves for assistance from the sidelines, and the trainer water boy come running in. Radar also appears from the  opposite sideline with water for his team. Ugly John take advantage of his presence to slip the hypodermic he has b concealing in his hand into Radar's pocket. Meanwhile there is agreement in the opposition camp that Ram halfback should go out of the game for a while to res up. A couple of his teammates assist him to the bench. Th Mash players observe this.
Well, he's taken care of. Scratch  one hot dog.
You really think we hurt him that  bad?
Hell, no, all you did was knock the  wind out of him. But he won't be  playing any more football today.

INT. 325TH EVAC TEAM'S DRESSING ROOM – DAY It is between the halves and the General's players are  resting, especially the ex-Cleveland tackles, who are  stretched out prone. General Hammond and his TRAINER (a medical Corps Captain) are concentrating on the ex-Los Angeles halfback, who sit on a table looking groggy. Henry sticks his head in the d
(to Ram halfback) The Trainer has to assist the man,  and the moment he lets go of him,  the halfback crumples to the floor.
(starting out again) Sorry. You obviously won't be wanting  any more bets.
The hell we won't! You bastards pulled  something, I don't know what, but  we've been beating you without him.  Ane we'll go on beating you!
You willing to b-back that up with  odds?
Damn right. Three to one, as much as  you want to put up.

EXT. ATHLETIC FIELD, 325TH EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY The two teams have taken the field again. Hawkeye has swi to left end, Spearchucker replacing him in the backfield. This time General Hammond's men are kicking off to Henry' It's a long kick but it doesn't go toward the center of t goal line, where Spearchucker is waiting for it, but to D who runs toward Spearchucker and tosses him an easy later The two pro tackles from the Browns run down the field so to converge on Spearchucker around the Mash twenty-five. the other Mash players divide themselves into equal units five to do nothing but take out the two tackles. The othe opposing players are no problem for Spearchucker, who run around or right through them, and crosses their goal line for a touchdown. The ball is brought out for the extra po which Duke scores with a place kick. Before the teams  reassemble for the next kickoff, the captain of the 325th team detours a few yards toward his bench and calls somet to General Hammond, whose reaction is to stand up and sha his fist in Henry's direction. On the Mash bench, Radar l over to Henry.
General Hammond, sir, has just been  informed about the identity of Captain  Jones. His ringers recognized our  ringer.
On the field Duke is preparing to kick off.
(to Spearchucker) What's the matter?
We may be in trouble, I can't catch  my breath. I've got the occupational  disease of oversized ex-athletes.

EXT. ATHLETIC FIELD, 325TH EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY Spearchucker is trying to block or intercept a forward pa but the two tackles from Cleveland still have enough stre left to put him out of action with their combined efforts They block him so forcibly, in fact, that he drops to the ground and has some trouble getting up. The pass is compl and the receiver tackled on the Mash thirty-five yard lin
Timeout! (to Referee as latter  blows whistle) How much left?
Minute and twenty-five seconds. And  that's a first down.
Radar comes out to the Mash huddle with his water-bucket towels.
We got to stop them right here.
And get ourselves another touchdown  to win. (looking to opponents'  huddle) I wish to hell we knew what they  were plotting.
(getting an idea) Radar!

All you have to do is ask. (concentrates on the  huddle twelve yards  away) The quarterback is saying they'll  run the old Statue of Liberty. Their  left end will come across and take  the ball out of his hand and try to  get around our left end.
What else?

Everyone's talking at once, but now  the captain is telling them to shut  up. The quarterback says, if the  Statue of Liberty doesn't work,  they'll go into the double wing with  the left halfback taking the handoff  first and then slipping it to the  right halfback heading to the left.

The Referee blows the whistle and the two teams line up t resume action. The 325th Evac quarterback drops back as i to pass, his left end starts to his right, and the whole  Mash eleven starts to their left. Only Ugly John finds hi temporarily buried under a 265-pound tackle. The other te men in red meet the enemy left end after he takes the bal off the quarterback's hand, and they bring him down for a loss. The opposing team goes into another huddle but thei strategy remains as Radar overheard it. When the left hal starts to his right, the Mash players start to their righ and after the right halfback takes over possession and tr to turn in, he finds himself hopelessly outnumbered.  Spearchucker hits him first with a tackle so fierce it th him back five yards and induces him to fumble the ball. A pile of half a dozen MASH players pounces on it, causing  some damage to each other.
(to Referee) Time!
He goes over to the Referee and exchanges a few words wit him, then walks into his team's huddle.
(to Spearchucker) You got to be the one. We're all  agreed on that.
No, it's too far and we're all too  bushed. I just told the referee we're  going to try something different. We  make the center eligible by...
Me? I can't catch a pass.

You don't have to. We line up with  everybody to the right of center  except Hawkeye, who drops back a  yard just before the snap. At the  same time Duke moves to the right  side of the line. (to Vollmer) That makes you eligible but all you  have to do is take the ball right  back from Trapper between your legs  and hide it under your belly. Trapper,  you make like you got the ball, fake  to me and keep going. One of the big  guys will hit you, maybe both...
No! I only got my GI insurance.
(to Vollmer) As soon as that happens, Sergeant,  you start walking, not running to  their goal line. Remember that, don't  run! Come on, we just got time!

They break out of the huddle and line up as directed, wit all the linemen except Hawkeye on Vollmer's right. Their  opponents have trouble adjusting to this and are even mor confused when, just as Trapper bends down to take the bal from Vollmer, Hawkeye steps back into the backfield and D squeezes into the already crowded right line. Returning t ball to Vollmer, Trapper turns his back, fakes a pitchout Spearchucker, who is racing toward the line, and continue backward, holding himself as if he still had the ball and were fading for a long pass. So successfully does he crea this impression that the two tackles from Cleveland, seei clearly that Spearchucker hasn't received the ball, desce on Trapper with their last burst of energy. Two other ora and-black linemen also fall on top of him. Meanwhile, Vol holding his arms crossed under his stomach to further hid the ball, and looking as if her were suffering from a pai blow beneath the belt, starts walking down the field at a angle toward his own sideline, making the opposition thin he is heading for the bench to seek relief from his injur Spearchucker stops running at about the enemy thirty, loo back to where Trapper's tacklers are beginning to remove  themselves, but also notes out of the corner of his eye t only the opposing safety man is anywhere near Vollmer and that he isn't paying much attention to him. From the bench a frantic Henry looks indignantly at the s of his center and Sergeant Major coming off the field.
What's going on? What the hell are  you doing?
He opens his arms enough for Henry to see the pigskin cra there.
Then run for God's sake! Run!

Vollmer begins to run straight toward the goal line, whic has the unfortunate effect of alerting the safety man to  what is happening. He races across the field to cut Vollmer off. Spearchucke starts into motion at the same instant and gets down ther so fast that just as the safety man is tackling Vollmer i way that would throw him out of bounds on the two-yard li Spearchucker hurls himself against the safety man with a  strong and well-aimed block that sends both men across th goal line. General Hammond runs onto the field in vehement protest.
Illegal! Illegal!

The Referee, looking at his watch and raising his Army .4 to signal the end of the game, goes over to meet the Gene and explain the sad truth to him. INT. MASH TEAM'S DRESSING ROOM – DAY Some of the players are partly undressed but most of them are too exhausted to begin that process. Trapper is stret out on a bench, apparently unconscious. Henry enters  triumphantly, waving a thick stack of paper money.
We got it, men... Ho-Jon's keep as  Androscoggin... if there is such a  place. And the big news is, the  General wants a rematch.
I'll tell you my news. I'm retiring  from football.
Me, too. Y'all just seen me play my  last game.
Same here. You can retire my number.
Well, there's one big satisfaction.
What's that, Henry?
I out-coached that General Hammond.
